Tile 4: Spend a horse and an ox to score 7 prestige points at the end of the game.







































FRENCH

Tuile 1 : Prenez la tuile gratuitement. A la fin de la partie elle vous rapporte 1 Point de prestige.

Tuile 2 : Dépensez 1 parchemin. En fin de partie vous gagnez 1 point de victoire pour chaque paire de tuiles client.

Tuile 3 : Pour pouvoir récupérer la tuile vous devez posséder le marqueur "prochain premier joueur" et le replacer dans la chambre du Conseil. A la fin de la partie elle vous rapporte 3 Point de prestige.

Tuile 4 : Dépensez 1 cheval et un 1 bœuf pour 7 points de prestige en fin de partie.

boardgameversion.174912: English first edition (included in the base game)

124118.name: Village: Customer Expansion

124119.name: Bonjour Médor
124119.description:
Similar to Bonjour Simone.
44 card shows dogs in different positions sometimes very similar.
Each turn card is drawn from the deck and players must greet dog, bark, sit up and beg or scratching fleas according to card.

If you're the slowest, make the wrong action etc. You take the card. The winner is the player ending with the fewest cards.

124120.name: Rejoin
124120.description:
"SparkSeed, the powerful source of energy we human being once had, was all missing, with just a spark left now. To find back the power we lost, you need to rejoin with your missed part lost in the new planet. By controlling the red energy ball, the missing energy blue ball will move in a different direction. Balance these two energy balls to collide them, meanwhile paying attention to lasers, springs, delivery gates, and props including intriguing floats and stings.

One would probably admit that controlling one bouncing ball in the air is not easy, yet it is even more difficult to balance two balls simultaneously that are moving in exactly two opposite directions! At such moments when these bouncing balls pass each other, will your brain get stuck? This game presents an ultimate challenge to coordination between the right and the left hemispheres of your brain!

Are you ready?

Highlights of Rejoin:

• 30 challenging and varied levels

• Physics based platforming action

• You can personalize or customize the way of collecting stars

• Challenge of coordination between the right and the left hemispheres of your brain!"

Source: The Developer Website.

124121.name: Shake Spears!
124121.description:
"Shake Spears is a game of GLORY, HONOR, and FAME! Become a valiant knight and enter tournaments to compete for the heart of a beautiful lady. Travel through FOUR worlds of wonder, win battles in 20 cities, and beat challenging bosses in this epic game. It's time to become a HERO for the ages!

Features

Four worlds with epic bosses
Opponent’s AI
Special abilities and skills
Magic artifacts
Unlimited upgrades
Stunning graphic and battle effects
iPhone 4 retina display support
Game Center leaderboard and achievements
OpenFeint support"

Source: The Developer Website.

124122.name: Simply Find It
124122.description:
User Summary

Simply find it is a puzzle game. Your goal is to spot the differences between two very similar pictures. The game has many pictures and it offers 3 different game modes.

124123.name: Dukes Chess
124123.description:
A chess variant that provides a larger board (8x9) and adds another piece to the standard chess set: The Duke.

The Duke can move 1, 2 or 3 spaces in any direction but is unable to capture in any adjacent space but can capture in the subsequent 2 or 3 spaces beyond that. The Duke may also jump over pieces to bypass them.

The Duke starts at the King's side, opposite the Queen.

124124.name: Cleon
124124.description:
Object of the game is to be the first to get rid of your cards by dressing Cleon, the chameleon

The game consists 48 cards which can be either a head or body, or tail for 16 different chameleons. Each creature will be 2 colors (unique combination), but each of these colors will be found on other chameleons, in different combinations.

Early in the game, the dealer prepares a single chameleon, with elements of the same color, it raises the center of the table. The cards are then shuffled and the dealer deals eight cards to each participant.

In turn, the active player will try play one of his cards to replace a body part of the chameleon in the middle of the table.
- this card must be the same body part as the removed card.
- this card must have a color in common with one of the neighboring cards.

If the active player can't play, he draws one card and passes.

Player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner.

124125.name: Ifs & Butts
124125.description:
This party game is played over an agreed-upon number of rounds. During each round, an "If" scenario is read aloud; for example, "If you needed to break the ice on a date, what would you say?" Every player except the reader writes a response and gives it to the reader, who chooses one to read to the group. Each player besides the reader then writes down who he thinks wrote that response. The correct guessers get points, and the process is repeated for each response.

Meanwhile, at the beginning of each round, "Butts" are assigned to certain players, who will receive points if they perform those "Butts" correctly throughout the round. An example would be, "Raise your arms in the air whenever you speak."

124126.name: curse the darkness

rpghonor.22911: 2013 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee

124126.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2012, a mysterious, unnamed individual conquered the world, leveling cities and destroying institutions of finance, religion, nationality and other ideology. He demanded that the people of the world take care of each other, with no promise of reward in the afterlife and no monetary compensation. Anyone who dissented and tried to hold on to their ideological identity was executed. The man wielded a force that no one on Earth could match - the creatures from the Between.

The Between is the place behind shadows, and it connects every shadow on the planet. While the man who destroyed the world isn't the only one capable of accessing the Between (in fact, your character can be an Opener if you'd like!), He does seem to be the only one with the ability to control the monsters therein. He sent these monsters out after anyone still clinging to religion, national identity, politics or economics, and those people were either killed on the spot or dragged into the Between, never to be seen again.

It's been 10 years. Over the ensuing decade, His oversight has grown less stringent, to the point that expressing one's faith or beliefs isn't quite so dangerous anymore. The people living in this world gather together in small, often mobile communities, doing their best to take care of themselves and each other. But some people just aren't interested in helping, and seek to take what they need. Some people tempt fate by trying to bring back religious worship or commerce, or other overt forms of ideology.

And some people still feel, even after so much death and destruction, that it's possible to win back the world.

The System

curse the darkness uses an original game system based around playing cards. Unlike many RPGs, it doesn't have a skill list or a complicated system for resolving combat and other situations. Instead, players undertake two kinds of Challenge: Character and Removal.

A Character Challenge helps define the character, and resolves an action that doesn't carry a risk of death or removal from the story. Character Challenges are based on one of four Attributes, each corresponding to a suit of cards: Focus (Diamonds), Stability (Clubs), Stamina (Spades) and Humanity (Hearts).

A Removal Challenge happens when the characters enter a situation that might lead to one or more of them being taken out of the game. Removal Challenges aren't based on the four Attributes, but on the characters' actions within the context of the situation. Characters in curse the darkness can and do die, much more easily than in many other RPGs.

The death of a character, however, can spur the survivors on to accomplishing their goal. When a character dies or leaves play, the others can gain Memory Points from that loss, and use those to find the inner fire to finish the scenario. Of course, the players also each have the option to refuse to fight, to be simply swept along by events.

Everything in the game, then, comes down to this essential choice: light a candle, or curse the darkness?

124129.name: To Cry a Joust
124129.description:
The hoof beats thunder. The crowd roars. Two knights' lances leveled, charge towards each other. Easy to learn and easy to play. You will be charging down your opponent in no time. D6 mechanics handle movement and combat.

You basically attempt to pick one of 3 cards to get a rock, paper, scissors +1 advantage over your opponent and another +1 or +2 impact advantage if you manage down most of the tilt before your opponent.

You can play one on one contests, or organize tournaments with any number of players. Paper figures and field are included to get you started quickly.

124130.name: Enter The Shadowside
124130.description:
From the website/Press Release:

Life is a resistance to what came before it, and what comes after. The universe of things is the illusion, as is the sense of birth as our beginning and death as our end.

At a primal level you know this to be true: the squareness of this world has made your mind wander, and in dreams you've been given glimpses of elsewhere. You remember what this elsewhere felt like, because you've been there. Think back of when you were a child: late at night you wake up for nor reason, your eyes go to the closet, it's dark. Remember what that felt like. The details don't matter -the details are gone. It's the scent what stayed with you. Others disregard it. Maybe you tried to, and can't. You suspect right.

The hidden wars do rage all around you; and you suspect right every time you feel their echoes whispering down the back of your neck.

Take the next step. Let Belief be your key, your door and your doorknob. Let it guide you to a place where you can will anything into existence by simply hoping (or fearing) it’s already there. Because it most certainly is. Dreams and nightmares, Cogito Ergo Mundus - the Shadowside.

Enter The Shadowside, a paranormal-themed RPG set in modern times and based on the Jacob's Ladder system, an innovative visual device which resolves conflict through the properties of geometry.

124131.name: Youda Survivor
124131.description:
User Summary

Youda Survivor is an economic resource management game developed by Youda and published by G5 (on mobile devices) and Big Fish Games (on Windows and Mac OSX). In it, the player is a prophesized "foreigner" who washes up shore in a tribal, prehistoric land. To prove himself, he must lead this budding civilization to prosperity. Youda Survivor consists of timed levels in which the player manages multiple currencies and tries to achieve multiple victory conditions.

124132.description:
Spurs and Sprockets is a perfect information, abstract strategy game for two players. Players have eight matching tiles that they take turns placing orthogonally into a 4 X 4 grid, in an attempt to link three or four in a row. There is no board in Spurs and Sprockets so the grid grows organically, based on the placement of tiles.

Spurs and Sprockets comes with sixteen tiles and rules for four different ways of playing, ranging from a simple Tic-Tac-Toe-like game where players gain 8 points for four in a row and 3 points for each set of three in a row, to a game where every placement of a tile may result in an attack and removal of another tile.
124132.name: Spurs and Sprockets

124133.name: Autoduel Illustrated (Issue 1 - Mar 2001)

rpgissuearticle.79287: Internet Duelling League After Action Report

124133.description:
User Summary

This issue consists of one long article that describes the Internet Duelling League's first online duel.

124134.name: The Lance: Legend of the Jouster
124134.description:
User Summary

Take on the role of a lone warrior who dreams of winning the Kings tournament to win the prized lance. In this game which takes place over multiple generations you will joust against foes to prove your excellence to the king. Wear your equipment as long as possible to get all the experience out of it, then upgrade at the right time to repair damaged equipment and gain additional benefits from higher level equipment. Aim your spear wisely to take advantages of your opponents weaknesses, but take care not to hit their horse.

124135.name: Autoduel Illustrated (Issue 2 - Jun 2001)
124135.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Best Laid Plans (by Dave 'Stee1 Cobra' McGee) & Awards Are Handed Out.

124136.name: Autoduel Illustrated (Issue 3 - Sep 2001)
124136.description:
User Summary

In this issue: Boodbath 20K Writeup; Interview with John Lewis; and "Victory", article by Curt Lindmark (the winner).

boardgamecompilation.195338: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Complete Hero Variant Collection

124138.description:
After his defeat at the hands of The Ennead, Ra wandered the Sahara alone for years. Now, he has returned as a symbol of hope, and an avatar of vengeance!

Innate Power: "Sunrise" - Draw 3 cards. Discard 2 cards.
124138.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Ra, Horus of Two Horizons Promo Card

124139.name: Idol Mahjong Final Romance R
124139.description:
User Summary

This is the third version of the Mahjong simulation game series released for the Sega Saturn.

The player participates in one-on-one games of strip Mahjong with five different girls in an attempt to watch them disrobe via animated videos.

124140.name: Mobile Suit Gundam Side Story II: Ao wo Uketsugu Mono
124140.description:
User Summary

This is the second in a trilogy of games about the One Year War in the Mobile Suit Gundam universe for the Sega Saturn.

The player takes control of a mobile suit and plays the game from the cockpit view, and must manage ammo, armor, energy, and more while fighting Zeon mechs and completing vital missions for the Earth Federation.

124141.name: Mini Mouth
124141.description:
In Mini Mouth, players race to create words with the letters on display, with the fastest mouth claiming the letters used.

To set up the game, place all the letter tiles face down and shuffle them. One player chooses 2-5 tiles and reveals them, then everyone races to name a word that includes all of the letters revealed. (One caveat: If more than one letter with an asterisk is revealed – those letters being J, Q, X and Z – then players need to use only one of these letters in their word.) The player who first names a word that includes the letters claims all of the letters used. If no one can think of a word or players simultaneously call out an acceptable word, return the letters to the letter pool. The next player clockwise then draws 2-5 tiles and the game continues.

As soon as no tiles remain in the letter pool, the player with the most tiles wins!

124143.name: Persona
124143.description:
A pseudo-psychology game, intending to reveal how much you know about your friends and, in return, what they think of you. This is not how to win the game though. The winner is the player with the most points at the end. You earn points by lying, choosing good moves for your playing piece or by drawing cards (100% luck).

Movement is by the roll of two dice. You have two playing pieces (your 'ego' and your 'id'. At ther start, just the ego is used. But once the hex 'Inferiority Complex' has been passed, you bring your id on to the board. Thereafter, you can move one piece the total of the dice rolled or you can move both your playing pieces by allocating one die to the ego and one die to the id. There are lots of cards, five types and when you land on certain hexes you have to take a card and obey the instructions.

124144.name: Yackety Smack!
124144.description:
The party game Yackety Smack! features a voice recorder called the Sound Smacker and sixty cards divided into four types: singer, slime, karate kid and "Your Choice".

After the cards are shuffled and dealt, the youngest player records two sounds on the Sound Smacker that match the images on two cards, e.g. "Trolololo" and "Squish". The "Your Choice" card allows for, as the name suggests, a sound of your choice.

After this, the players start flipping over their cards in turns. As soon as two face-up cards correspond to the recorded sounds, the first player to smack the Sound Smacker wins and takes all revealed cards and adds these to his face-down pile. The game ends at the end of a round if one or more players have no cards in hand.

The player who collected the most cards wins!

124145.name: Commando Quarterly (Issue 1 - Oct 2005)
124145.description:
From the front cover:

• Painting Shadowrun Miniatures
• 15 Tips for Shadowrun GMs
• Bodyguard of Lies
• Explorer Corps Survey
• Prometheus Unbound

124146.name: Cartoon It!
124146.description:
Sharpen your memory and your drawing pencil as you play Cartoon It! Each round, you have 30 seconds to memorize a cartoon character with six specific features shown on the character card; each feature (shape of the head, type of eyes, etc.) occurs in six different ways, which are summarized on the Features Board – but you can't look at this board while memorizing the character!

Once time is up, all players draw their cartoon character from memory using hints from the Features Board. As soon as one player finishes, everyone else has 30 seconds to complete their drawings. Each player passes the drawing and character card to another player, who then scores the drawing. Proper head shape? Check! Tongue not showing? No point for you! The more accurate the drawing, the more points the drawer scores, with an extra point for the player who finished drawing first. (For younger players, you can be more lenient with what counts as an accurate drawing.)

The player with the most points after five rounds wins!

124147.description: High Frontier Colonization, an expansion to both the first and second editions of High Frontier, includes all the elements of the first edition expansion (now out of print), but adds maps, cards, and playing pieces. The thriving space infrastructure has hundreds of specialists working in space colonies orbiting Earth. These provide services such as antimatter manufacture, beamed solar energy, cycler satellites, space telescopes, the space elevator, and of course the local tax office. New Bernal, Colonist, Freighter, and GW Thruster modules allow you to move your base of operations further afield in the High Frontier. The promoted side of the cards in the last two modules include new paths to victory called Futures.
124147.name: High Frontier Colonization

124148.name: Commando Quarterly (Issue 2 - Jan 2006)
124148.description:
From the front cover:

• 2005: A Year in Review
• SR4 Missions: Welcome to Denver!
• Bodyguard of Lies
• TRO: Vehicle Annex - Preview!
• The Bounty Hunter

124149.name: Commando Quarterly (Issue 3 - April 2006)
124149.description:
From the front cover:

• Making a Statement
• Q&A with Randall Bills
• Last Painter Standing
• Poison Ghosts
• Sword and Dragon - Preview!

124150.name: Cardboard Baseball
124150.description: Baseball simulation game that recreates player performance based on simple stats found on everyday baseball cards. Game uses a standard deck of cards for quick play resolution. The player simply flips a card, refers to a specific pitcher stat as dictated by the chart and if the pitcher fails that check goes on to do the same for the batter. The game advertises itself as not one trying to replicate pinpoint statistical accuracy but attempts to make baseball cards come to life.

124152.name: Ice3
124152.description:
Ice3 is a game played with ice cubes!

Each player starts with some cards and an ice cube, which is placed on a plastic stand. The cards are placed on the table to create the path on which the ice cubes will progress. Some cards make it possible to attack another player's ice cube – dipping it in a glass of cold water, warming it with your hand, blowing on it, putting a pinch of salt on it, etc. – to make it melt a little. Other cards allow you to defend yourself – well, your ice cube anyway – by preventing an attack. If your ice cube melts completely before the end of the game, you're eliminated.

The first player to bring his cube to the 25th card wins.

124154.name: Dead Reign Sourcebook 3: Endless Dead
124154.description:
From publisher blurb:

As time goes on, the zombie hordes only grow in size and strangeness. This book contains horrifying new zombies to haunt your player characters along with new O.C.C.s and tons of tables for detailing Survivors’ Hideouts, Safe Haven Communities, Death Cults and more. Survival is not enough. Now is the time for the war against the Endless Dead.

New types of zombies like the Fused Zombie, Multi-Zombie, Parasite Juggernaut and Walking Mass Grave.
New O.C.C.s including the Survivalist, Watcher, Wheelman, Zombie Hunter and Zombie Researcher.
More information on vehicles and tables for adding custom armor, weapons and anti-zombie defenses.
Rules for vehicle combat and zombie-fighting in vehicles.
Generation tables and random encounter tables for military bases, police stations, gun stores, buildings, suburbs, industrial parks, small towns, farmland and wilderness.
Tables for creating Survivor caravans, hideouts, hermits, Safe Haven Communities and Death Cults.
Timetable for setting campaigns during the Wave, the beginning of the Zombie Apocalypse or months into the reign of the dead.
Stats for some of North America’s dangerous wildlife, a threat to survivors and zombies alike.

124156.description:
Each card in the Word Wars deck represents one of two letters. Orient the card one way for one letter, or rotate it 180 degrees to use the other letter. The letters may have different point values.

Each player is dealt ten cards and uses them to make three words. Each player adds up the values of the letters in each word and then ranks his words in order from lowest total to highest total. The lowest total words of all the players are compared, and the player whose word has the greatest total scores. The same is done for the other two words. Play an agreed-upon number of rounds.
124156.name: Word Wars I.II.III

124157.name: Devinettes d'Epinal À Colorier
124157.description:
42 cards in seven sets of six. The sets are named;
1. Contes
2. Soldats
3. Mythologie
4. Métiers
5. Campagne
6. Brigands
7. Animaux

Players must collect as many sets as they can by asking for cards in one of the sets that they have at least one card in that set in their hand. When all the sets are grouped together, the player with the most wins.

This is a reproduction of a game published by Grimaud around 1848, so the graphics are rather interesting.

124158.name: Pick-a-Pair
124158.description: From the publisher's website: Players or teams compete to list familiar pairs of words or phrases that fit a category for each round. For example, “salt & pepper” fits the category “Food or Cooking”. Score points for pairs not listed by other players. Score extra points for pairs that rhyme, pairs that use the same word twice, triples (three main words or phrases like "red, white & blue"), or quadruples (four main words or phrases). Play 4-8 rounds in a game.

124159.name: Эй! Это моя рыба!
124159.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Эй! Это моя рыба! is a non-authorized version of Hey, That's My Fish!. According to designer Günter Cornett, Zvezda issued this game without credit to him nor Alvydas Jakeliunas, thus it is set apart from the official entry of Hey, That's My Fish!.




Players catch fish by moving penguins around the play areas, claiming fish tile they leave at the start of their turn. Pieces must move in a straight line and cannot cross voids, and thus the game board becomes smaller and the options fewer as the game progresses.

This edition has fewer penguins than the original (13 each instead of 16) and adds a shark figure that moves according to a die roll and a six-point compass printed on a board. A player loses a fish whenever one of their penguins encounters the shark.

124160.name: The Strategy Game
124160.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that The Strategy Game is a non-authorized version of Blokus.




Players place geometric figures onto the board, but must place such that their new piece touches at least one of their previous pieces, but at corners only. The player who gets the most of his or her pieces placed by the end of the game is the winner.

Though named the same, this is not identical to The Strategy Game, a similar unauthorized replica but of Blokus Duo i.e. just for two players.

124161.name: Dark Knights Dice Game
124161.description:
Dark Knights is a "press your luck" style dice game that is played with six dice. 3 dice are dark and 3 dice are light. The dark dice represent the lower scoring dice, and the light represent the higher scoring dice. A pen and paper are also needed for keeping score.

Points are scored by matching numbers (or face values) on dice. The point value is determined by the numbers rolled as well as the shade of dice within the combination(s) set aside.

124163.name: Flying Coffins
124163.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Enemy planes are not the only things hunting in the sky…

Early winter, 1918. You are members of the Royal Flying Corps stationed near the Front and rumour has it, the next big push is about to begin. The squadron’s being worked to death, and its champion ace is on the verge of cracking up. Meanwhile the new Hun Circus is racking up kill after kill – but is it the enemy or something else that’s to blame?

A sortie into Hunland to tackle an observation balloon ends in a fierce scrap with Jasta 32. Great winged beasts, agents of Death itself, are glimpsed flying in and out of the clouds. On the ground, flying ace MacMurdo knows more than he’s letting on but he is on the edge. Reporting it to Command won’t do any good, but talking to Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, military journalist, might. Combat takes its toll, and the date of the Push draws near. It’s up to you to make the skies safe and not just from the German planes.

124164.name: Cuisinons
124164.description:
French card game aimed at youngsters to get them interested in food preparation.

Eight recipe cards are placed in the centre of the table. Each player gets six random ingredient cards. In a turn, a player must place one ingredient if he can, to one of the recipe cards. He then replenishes his hand. Play proceeds until one recipe card is completed with all its ingredients. The player who laid the final ingredient claims the recipe card which will be worth a number of points. The more ingredients a recipe needs, the more points it is worth.

When all the recipes are claimed, the player with the most points, wins.

124165.name: Zumba Fitness 2
124165.description:
Zumba Fitness 2 is a video game currently being developed by Zoë Mode and will be published by Majesco Entertainment based on the Zumba program. It is a sequel to Zumba Fitness. It was launch first on the Wii in November 2011 and then to Kinect for Xbox 360 in February 2012 under the title Zumba Fitness Rush.

Gameplay

Players can learn and perfect nine different dance styles: Reggaeton, Merengue, Salsa, Cumbia, Hip hop, Mambo, Rumba, Flamenco and Calypso as well as new routines including the Axe, Indian, Latin Pop, Bellydance and Pasodoble. led by Zumba creator Beto and celebrity instructors Gina Grant and Tanya Beardsley. New features include a calorie tracker, revamped gameplay, and graphical representations of the instructors.

Soundtrack

The game will use licensed tracks for its soundtrack, which includes "Pause" by Pitbull as the game's theme song. Other songs confirmed for the game include a Zumba version of "Poison" by Nicole Scherzinger, and "We No Speak Americano" by Yolanda Be Cool & DCUP.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zumba Fitness 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124166.name: Space Fleet Wars
124166.description:
"Whether its a light skirmish or a full scale fleet battle you'll need to use all your strategy skills to become a victorious Space Fleet Wars Commander.

Plan your attack, issue the orders and watch as your ships execute them, then wait for the almost inevitable retaliation.

You must use you ships wisely, know when to move forward and attack, defend with shield boosters or even sacrifice a ship for the greater good.

Its kill or be killed out there in the war zone so you'll have to learn fast to survive."

Source: The Developer Website.

124167.name: The Color Game
124167.description:
"The Color is a deceptively simple game that will challenge your vision, memory and concentration. With two unique game modes, original soundtrack and Game Center support, The Color will captivate you.

Source: The Developer Website.

124168.name: Troll Blaster: Physics Strategy and Puzzle Action Game
124168.description:
"In Troll Blaster, each level presents a new challenge for the player. The trolls are in structures to the right of the screen that are build of wood, stone, glass and metal. With an arsenal of four weapons, a cross bow, cannon, fire cannon and grenade launcher, the player must strategically select which weapon to use and in what order. Each weapon carries a different strength and has a different effect on the structures. The player must decide strategically which weapon is most appropriate to fire at different points within the structures to destroy the most trolls. Additionally, there is also an element of aim required as there are trolls that could only be killed by direct hits but require skill in aiming."

Source: The Developer Website.

124170.description:
This is a programmed paragraph-based adventure game with tactical combat. It is very similar to, and compatible with, Melee and Wizard of Metagaming's The Fantasy Trip. Legends of the Ancient World is the fantasy genre series of these games from Dark City Games. Emerald Twilight is a jungle themed adventure in the series. It is designed to play very well solo, but rules are provided to run it more like an RPG with one or more players cooperating to complete the adventure with another player administering the game as a referee.

Battles are fought with counters on a hex map that is included with the game.
124170.name: Legends of the Ancient World: Emerald Twilight

137837.name: Tsuro of the Seas: Veterans of the Seas

124172.description:
The basic game play of Tsuro of the Seas resembles that of Tom McMurchie's Tsuro: Players each have a ship that they want to sail — that is, keep on the game board — as long as possible. Whoever stays on the board the longest wins the game.

Each turn players add "wake" tiles to the 7×7 game board; each tile has two "wake connections" on each edge, and as the tiles are placed on the board, they create a connected network of paths. If a wake is placed in front of a ship, that ship then sails to the end of the wake. If the ship goes off the board, that player is out of the game.

What's new in Tsuro of the Seas are daikaiju tiles, representing sea monsters and other creatures of the deep. Notably, daikaiju can move: each tile has five arrows, four for moving in each of the cardinal directions and another one for rotation. On the active player's turn, he rolls two six-sided dice; on a sum of 6, 7, or 8, the daikaiju will move, while on any other sum they'll stay in place. To determine which direction the daikaiju tiles move, the player then makes a second roll, this time with a single die. On 1-5 in the second roll, each daikaiju moves according to its matching arrow. On a 6 in the second roll, a new daikaiju tile is added to the board.

If a daikaiju tile hits a wake tile, a ship, or another daikaiju tile, the object hit is removed from the game. Another way to be ousted! The more daikaiju tiles on the game board, the faster players will find themselves trying to breathe water...
124172.name: Tsuro of the Seas

124176.name: Race of the Turtles and Hares
124176.description:
For two players

Object: to get all checkers from one aide of the board in the illustrated squares to the opposite side.

Place 22 red and 22 black checkers on the squares with illustrations on them. Players shake the dice and moves either one or two men diagonally across the board toward the other side. If 1 man is moved add the pips of the dice roll together and move that many squares. If 2 men are moved then move each checker the number of squares showing on each die. Players may jump their own or their opponents men.

Player first reaching the opposite side with all his men wins the game.
Rules from National Games Archives.

124177.name: Desecration
124177.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second in a series of 6-Pack Adventures, pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2–4 hours of play and containing everything you need.

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.

Desecration has a group of elven adventurers investigating strange goings on in some of their holy woodland—at the behest of a goddess no less...

124178.name: Incursion
124178.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 6-Pack Adventure: pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2-4 hours of play and containing everything you need!

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.

Incursion has a village suffering at the hands of strange invaders, a threat that could spread to the whole world if the characters don't intervene...

124179.name: The Sting
124179.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 6-Pack Adventure: pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2-4 hours of play and containing everything you need!

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.

The Sting has a band of experienced adventurers following a clue to an abandoned temple that, perhaps, isn't as abandoned as it first appears...

124180.name: Battle's End
124180.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 6-Pack Adventure: pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2-4 hours of play and containing everything you need!

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.

Battle's End has a group of adventurers taking their rest from their individual wanderings in an inn, The Battle's End. Their rest is due to be interrupted however as the village comes under a mysterious assault by the legions of the undead...

124181.name: Thulu!
124181.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 6-Pack Adventure: pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2-4 hours of play and containing everything you need!

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.

THULU! Has a ragged band of grizzled warriors trying to hold off the orc horde long enough for relief to arrive.

124182.name: Kiss of the Frog God
124182.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The first 6-Pack adventure for Lamentations of the Flame Princess and compatible old school systems sees the characters entering the cursed town of Morbury where people are missing and something foul and twisted lurks in the godless swamps.

6-Pack Adventures have everything you need for an evening's gaming—battlemat, tokens, monsters, pregenerated characters and adventure!

124183.name: Black Rock Bandits
124183.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of our 6-Pack Adventures, pick-up-and-play adventures designed to fill 2-4 hours of play and containing everything you need.

Battle Map
Tokens
Pre-generated characters




For longevity you can use the tokens and the map for anything else you care to do and the adventures should be fairly easily adaptable to fit into your existing campaign if you want.
In Black Rock Bandits ties of family and friendship lead a party of concerned villages to the malign Black Rock in hopes of ending a scourge of banditry and getting to the bottom of what has happened to someone they care about.

124184.name: Urban Faerie Pocket Edition
124184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tidied up, tinkered with, added to (a little) and wrapped up in a somewhat shinier package. This is the Urban Faerie Pocket Edition.

Faeries living like rats in the walls cause havoc for the filthy humans. A beer-and-crisps game you can pick up and play in short order, even while drunk.

From "Notes on the Pocket Edition:"

The Pocket Edition is sort of a halfway house between an entirely new edition and a reprint. There's been some additional editing, a few additions, a few lessons learned from the similar Invaderz and some decent artwork thanks to Linda.

134392.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Freedom Six Promo Pack

124185.description:
Devra Caspit always had a knack for building things, even from a young age. However, her family was shocked when she began building and inventing things without even touching them. She could simply think about the components in front of her and begin assembling them in her mind, and the pieces would align themselves! She was a technopath – anything she could visualize, she could build, given the right parts.

By the time she was eighteen, she had already dropped out of three different universities, as she didn't have the patience for classes. She spent her time cobbling her pencils, paperclips, and other students' belongings into adorable mechanical golems which danced around the classroom, which did not go over well with anyone.

Recently, she received word from the Eaken-Rubendall Laboratories that there may be a position open for a person of her skills, if she would be interested in working with Dr. Stinson...

Unity, the technopath, uses her innate abilities to control technology and create mechanical golems to fight for her. Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unity Hero Character is a standalone hero character with her own unique deck of 40 hero cards and a character card.
124185.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unity Hero Character

124186.name: Argent Burst
124186.description:
User Summary

Very similar to Missile Command. You have a number of cities to defend, and three turrets which can fire upon incoming missiles in attempt to destroy them.

124187.name: Nyan Cat FLY!
124187.description:
User Summary

As Nyan cat flies through space, you must keep him happy. To do so, eat as many cookies, candies and sweets as possible, and make sure to avoid the vegetables.

124190.name: Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box
124190.description:
From the publisher's website:

What's Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box?

Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box is a separate, free version of Hero Lab that only supports Paizo's Pathfinder Beginner Box.

Unlike the regular version of Hero Lab, Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box is free for all users! That means that anyone can download and use it to create Beginner Box characters or manage Beginner Box encounters.

Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box supports the character creation rules from the Hero's Handbook and Player Pack, as well as allowing the creation of monsters from the Gamemaster's Guide and GM Kit.

Players can create characters from any of the Beginner Box races and classes and advance them from levels 1 to 5. GMs can create monsters and entire encounters, and manage them using Hero Lab's powerful Tactical Console.

Features

For new RPG players, Hero Lab walks you through each step of character creation, helpfully prompting you through the process. Meanwhile, experienced players can use Hero Lab's power and flexibility to create characters in minutes.

All modifiers to skills and abilities due to class, race, ability scores, feats, and more are automatically calculated for you. These include extra feats or skill points, save modifiers, combat modifiers, extra spells, skill bonuses, etc, saving you time and lots of page flipping.

Ideal for both players and GMs - players can create and advance a level 1 starting character, while GMs can create a level 5 orc wizard NPC to use against the players.

Let Hero Lab handle the complexity to make it easier for you to keep up with your character. Instantly see how many ability score bonuses, custom abilities, and other special powers you get as you level up.

For appropriate classes, choose from the full selection of customizable abilities. Pick your Rogue Talents, Arcane Bonds, Rage Powers, Bonus Feats and Arcane Schools - Hero Lab takes them all into account for your character.

As you fight monsters and gain powerful magic items, you can add them to Hero Lab with only a few clicks. Costs are automatically calculated and magical modifiers applied when you equip the item. Choose how much to pay, based on whether you find the item or buy it from a merchant with a surcharge or discount.

Damage, class and attack bonus of weapons is automatically calculated, based on the weapons, your class and your proficiencies and ability scores.

Unmet pre-requisites are properly flagged. For example, unavailable feats are marked with their list of requirements, so you can see at a glance which ones are and aren't available for your character.

Choose which weapons and armor to equip. Your attack bonus, armor class and armor check penalty are calculated automatically.

Generate a random age, height and weight based on your race and character class.

Once your hero is complete, you can generate standard text, HTML, BBCode or Wikitext statblocks, save your hero as a PDF to upload to a website, or print out a character sheet to use at the game table.

For players, Hero Lab for the Pathfinder Beginner Box includes level 1 versions of Valeros, Kyra, Ezren and Merisiel, so you can use them as a basis for your own characters.

For GMs, Hero Lab includes all the monsters from the Gamemaster's Guide and GM Kit, allowing you to import them into your encounters with just a few clicks of the mouse.

GMs can use Hero Lab's Tactical Console and powerful in-play support to manage entire encounters, instead of using spreadsheets or pen and paper. Create your encounters in Hero Lab beforehand, then manage the combatants in Hero Lab to make combats a snap!

124191.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 1: Episode 1: A New Day

videogameseries.21080: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series

videogamehonor.20115: 2012 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee

videogamecompilation.141646: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - The Complete First Season

124191.description:
Episode one of a five-part game series set in the same universe as Robert Kirkman’s award-winning series. Play as Lee Everett, a convicted criminal, who has been given a second chance at life in a world devastated by the undead. Experience events, meet people and visit locations that foreshadow the story of Deputy Sheriff Rick Grimes. A tailored game experience – actions, choices and decisions you make will affect how your story plays out across the entire series. Additional episodes available as downloadable content.

Source: The Game Website.

124192.name: Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch

videogamehonor.37499: 2011 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner

124192.description:
The story of Ni no Kuni revolves around thirteen-year-old Oliver, a resident of Hotroit City, whose mother, Arie, suddenly dies after rescuing him from drowning. A doll, given to Oliver by his mother, is brought to life from his tears and reveals itself to be a male fairy named Shizuku, who gives Oliver a book that allows him to use the power of magic and enter the world of "Ni no Kuni," a reality parallel to his own. In Ni no Kuni, Shizuku says, Oliver may be able to find his mother, Arie. Using the newfound power of magic, Oliver and Shizuku venture into Ni no Kuni. There, he befriends Maru, Gyro, and other alternate versions of people (and animals) he knows.

Formerly subtitled Ni no Kuni: the Another World, Level-5 announced on June 24, 2010 that this title has been replaced with two separate subtitles for the DS and PlayStation 3 versions, with the subtitle of the DS version being Ni no Kuni: Shikkoku no Madōshi and the PlayStation 3 version titled as Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch. Level-5 also revealed that both versions are being developed separately from scratch, and as such will feature different data, artwork, graphics, specifications and story developments, while only retaining the same "story axle". The PlayStation 3 version will feature graphics and visuals replicating Ghibli's traditional animation style and its artwork for the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ni no Kuni", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124193.name: What's the Link?
124193.description:
Each player has a card that features seven one-word clues. Each clue calls for a one-word answer that will complete a compound word or two-word phrase. For example, the clue may be "Black" and the answer "Jack".

The reader reads the first clue from his card, and the other players shout out as many possible answers as they can think of in ten seconds. The first player to guess the correct answer moves his playing piece three spaces on the board. If no one guesses the correct answer, the reader makes up a sentence to help out the guessers, such as, "Ben likes to visit Vegas to play Black ________." A correct guess now earns both the reader and the guesser two spaces on the board. The next player becomes the reader, and play continues until one player reaches the Finish line.

124194.name: Castlevania: Rondo of Blood
124194.description:
Castlevania: Rondo of Blood, known in Japan as Akumajō Dracula X: Chi no Rondo (悪魔城ドラキュラX 血の輪廻, officially translated Devil's Castle Dracula X: Rondo of Blood) is a platform video game developed by Konami for the PC Engine. The tenth installment of the Castlevania video game series and a 2D side-scroller, it acts as a middleground between the earlier, typically linear Castlevania games and the later open-exploration ones; Rondo of Blood makes use of untimed stages with a clear beginning, but occasionally more than one ending.

Gameplay

The objective is to guide the primary player character Richter Belmont through nine stages, with four alternate routes, as he searches for his kidnapped beloved Annette and ultimately confronts Dracula in his castle. Richter makes use of a whip as his main weapon and one of six sub-weapons: an axe, a dagger, holy water, a grimoire, a pocket watch, and a cross. While exploring the castle, Richter can rescue four maidens, including Annette's young sister Maria Renard who then becomes a playable character. She attacks using her doves and one of six sub-weapons: a cat, dragon, cardinal, turtle, egg or musical notes.

Rondo of Blood incorporates elements from the earlier Castlevania games which typically featured linear gameplay and a member of the Belmont clan as the protagonist, and the later entries which emphasized untimed exploration of the environment. Rondo of Blood makes use of untimed stages with a clear beginning, but more than one ending to some levels; this then affects the subsequent environment, monsters, and boss monster that the player character encounters at the end of the level. Items such as money, hearts, and food can be found scattered throughout the areas. Rondo of Blood also features the Item Crash ability reused in subsequent Castlevania titles, which allows a sub-weapon to be used in a super attack. Its direct sequel, Castlevania: Symphony of the Night, reuses many of the monsters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Castlevania: Rondo of Blood", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124195.name: Tide of Battle
124195.description:
Tide of Battle is a customizable card game for 2 or 4 players.

Players take on the role of martial artists in combat with each other. Each player has a deck of 30 Tide of Battle cards, each card representing a martial arts technique. These cards are played as attacks or defenses against one another, with successful attacks subtracting from a target player's HP. A player begins with 30 HP and is knocked out, losing the game when that player reaches 0 HP.

124196.name: Math Twister
124196.description:
The red deck contains five each of the numbers one through ten. The green deck contains 90 consecutive numbers from 11 to 100. Four green cards are randomly placed face-up in a row. Eight red cards are randomly placed face-up ---- four in a row above the row of green cards and four in a row below the row of green cards.

Players simultaneously use the red numbers and up to four mathematical operations to form an equation that equals one of the green numbers. The red cards used in an equation are discarded; the player who formed the equation keeps the green card. The green card is replenished immediately. The red cards are replenished when no player can form an equation with the red cards that remain on the table.

Play continues either until a player's green card values equal an agreed-upon total or until a player acquires an agreed-upon number of green cards.

124197.name: Think Thrice
124197.description:
Think Thrice consists of 25 tiles, each with three attributes: the foreground color (red, yellow, or blue); the background color (green, violet, or orange); and the shape of the picture on the tile (sun, moon, or star).

Each player begins the game with four tiles. On his turn, a player either draws a tile from the bag or plays one or more tiles to the playing area to form one or more triads. A triad is a set of three tiles in which either an attribute is the same on all three tiles or it is different on all three tiles, as in the game of Set.

In making a play, a player may link his tiles to existing ones in the playing area or keep them separate. He also may re-arrange previously played tiles, provided that every tile in the playing area remains part of a triad.

The first player to run out of tiles wins.

124198.name: Goodfellas
124198.description:
Goodfellas is a party game for 4-6 players. A remake and retheme of the basic game and mechanics for Advanced Civilization, Goodfellas pits 1920's era mob bosses against each other. Each player starts with a plan to build their empire, focusing on Italian restaurants, speakeasies, barber shops and other familiar tropes. Starting back in their respective neighbourhoods, players assign their thugs to different locations where they can gather weapons, recruit more thugs, or otherwise build up their organization. In order to complete their empire they will need to go "downtown" where the real goodies are. The problem is downtown is small and everybody is trying to control the same bit of turf in order to get the materials they need. Get ready for the blood to flow!

Using beloved conventions of the mafia genre, Goodfellas will have players picking between tommy guns and piano wire, telling each other to "fuggetaboutit", and ALWAYS taking the cannoli in this fun game intended to make you laugh and strategize at the same time.

124199.description:
Raid sur Bruneval 1942 - Raid on Bruneval 1942 - (Operation Biting) is a solitary tactical game that appeared in the French Vae Victis magazine #104 (special game edition). It simulates the Raid of British paratroopers under Major Frost's command to capture a german radar near Bruneval (northwestern France) during the night of february 27th 1942. During this operation, the british dropped by parachute must capture the radar, one or two german operators, destroy the manor and finally embark all in the waiting Landing Craft Assaults.

The game is edited under ziplock and contains a A3-size map depicting Bruneval surroundings at night (scale at 1/25000), 108 counters (the 3 formation of British paratroopers Drake, Nelson and Rodney ; german coastal defense, luftwaffe guards, MGs, pill-boxes and part of 685th infantry regiment reinforcements ; activation and other markers). One typical counter unit represents around 10 men. The rules are included in a separate 15 pages A5-sized booklet.

The duration of the game is 13 turns from 0:15 et 03:15 am. The player plays the British side first each turn and then the activated german units fight, move and get reinforcements in this respective order. Except for the coastal defenses, the german units are not represented on the map at the beginning. Instead, several randomly selected activation markers are deployed in specific areas of the map. The combination of proximity to British units and alert level may trigger an activation marker that may hide from 0 to 4 german units. These activated units may then fight and move. German move is dictated by closest (in PM) and largest enemy stack or German stack. Combat is resolved by comparing the strength of both adjacent stacks modified by the presence of an officer, the terrain modifier and 1D6. Largest score inflicts one step loss to the other.
The British must score at least 10 victory points to get a marginal victory. More than 20 is a decisive victory. The historical score is 24 VP.
124199.name: Raid sur Bruneval 1942

124200.name: NieR RepliCant
124200.description:
User Summary

NieR RepliCant has an identical story to NIER/NieR Gestalt but was released exclusively in Japan on the Playstation 3. It features a 16 year old Nier and Yonah is his younger sister instead of his daughter.

124203.name: Ca$hflow the E-Game
124203.description:
Back of the box

It's Time to get out of the rat race!!

What's your dream? Freedom of time? Unlimited resources to travel the world? Whatever it may be, Ca$hflow the E-Game teaches you how to get out of the Rat Race and onto the Fast Track. Learn about money and finance in a fun, interactive environment to make more informed choices about money in your everyday life!

124204.name: Whirl Tour
124204.description:
Whirl Tour is a skateboarding video game released in 2002 to North America and in 2003 to the PAL region. The game was developed Papaya Studios for the GameCube and the PlayStation 2

The band Flipside is performing at a sold-out show when all the band members are abruptly sucked into a portal. The band's roadie, Wasa. B, jumps on his scooter and rides into the portal after the kidnapped musicians. Wasa B. must then skate through eight unique levels, defeat the bosses who guard the portal's power source, and finally face-off with the evil Dr. Skeezkicks, who masterminded the abduction. Each area possesses its own special challenges, and the player will need to master all of the tricks at Wasa B.'s disposal to emerge victorious and save his friends.

Source: Wikipedia, "Whirl Tour", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124205.name: Ca$hflow 202 The E-Game
124205.description:
Back of CD case

Cashflow 101 teaches you investing fundamentals
Cashflow 202 teaches you the technical investing. Put them together, you will learn the ultimate game of money. So take you time first with 101, then move to 202 and conquer the skills of becoming a Master of your Financial Universe.

124207.name: Shukuen: Merchant's Greed
124207.description:
Publisher Blurb

This is the first in a series of adventures tailored for Ninja or Ninja-like characters. As many GMs that have tried to run a Feudal Japanese campaign can attest, it can be difficult to cater to every class, especially the more specialized like the Ninja. One of our goals is to create a series of linked adventures for your ninja characters. Infiltration, Assassination, and Spying will be among the missions your ninjas will undertake in the name of honor and duty.

124208.name: Shukuen: The Abduction
124208.description:
Publisher Blurb

The Abduction is an adventure for all types of characters, set in feudal Japan in a fictitious Han. Characters must rescue the daughter of a minor noble who is to marry into another noble family. She has been kidnapped by persons unknown, and for unknown reasons. If she should die, the honor lost will surely cause the Han to collapse economically. You must not let this happen! Your small party has been chosen so as not to attract attention to the disaster.

124209.name: Gundam Battle Online
124209.description:
User Summary

Gundam Battle Online is a turn-based strategy and real time battle game set in the Mobile Suit Gundam universe.

The player gives orders to groups of pilots in mobile suits and attempts to complete a variety of missions. Each of the pilots has his or her own strength in battle whether it be as a support unit, combat unit, assault, defense, or maneuver (used for piloting the ships that the mechs head into battle with or protect). Additionally, some mechs are better suited for different types of jobs on the battlefield.

The game also features an online mode for up to four players.

124210.name: Enthüllt
124210.description: This is a party game with question cards in five categories (love, sex, life, spirituality and leisure). The active player rolls a color die to determine a category, reads the question on the first card of the corresponding color and answers it. The other players form a jury and award 0-5 points for the answer. The first player to reach a certain number of points (depending on the number of players) is the winner.

124211.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Federation vs Zeon
124211.description:
User Summary

Federation vs Zeon DX is a home port of the 3D, third person action arcade game by the same name, set in the Gundam universe.

The game is primarily a deathmatch between four players in mobile suits.

There was an updated version of the game released titled Kidou Senshi Gundam: Renpou vs Zeon DX that included more options, such as space battles.

The home versions included a Campaign Mode and unlockable Extra Mode.

The arcade mode had support for up to four players, while the PS2 versions supported two players, and the Dreamcast version only supported a single player.

124212.name: Jacked Up
124212.description:
Jacked Up!™ puts a new, interactive twist on traditional playing card games, combining normal playing cards with a digital application that changes the rules with every hand!

In the digital application, the "Joker" (named Jack!) interacts with players throughout the game, twisting and spinning the rules. As the rules change, the excitement builds.

Each Jacked Up card game package includes a special deck of cards, a smart phone stand, and a FREE app download (available for Apple and Android devices).

Scan the special cards with the free Jacked Up™ Smartphone app during game play to have Jack reveal new rules that add excitement to each game!

Source: The Developer Website.

124213.name: Bystle Vale
124213.description:
From the back cover

Falling into Adventure
Starting with a massive earthquake that opens a huge sinkhole in the middle of their home town, the party is swept into a race against time to recover magical components that will be crucial in the fight against the secret and sinister Cult of Yex. Aided by their benefactor, the old wizard Boxxaway Hotheway, the party is sent to recover the magic amplifying Bystle Moss that grows only in the heart of a gigantic tree fortress in a high forest vale. Featuring river based wilderness travel, a dungeon in the heart of a gigantic tree, a unique puzzle to escape a bizarre demi-plane, and the chance to kill Halfings...

A serial or stand alone adventure!
Beginning with a narrow escape from a massif earthquake, the party is swept into a relentless struggle against the savage and powerful Cult of Yex. Whether played on its own or part of the greater epic, the Cult of Yex is a deftly woven and thrilling epic d20 adventure.

Designer for 2-8 characters of Levels 1st - 3rd.

124214.name: Road to Armageddon Game Master's Handbook
124214.description:
from the back of the book

Road to Armageddon: The Game Master's Handbook provides the necessary framework for the creation of realistic characters for the "Road to Armageddon" post-holocaust setting, including:

The historical Background of the "road to armageddon"

The three major 20th century "task forces" and their leadership

Notes on production and logistics

The historical background of the "here and now" of the 25th millennium

Rules on Encounters - and a Bestiary of the creatures that may be encountered

A Gazetteer of the Middle Sea and the surrounding areas

124215.name: Road to Armageddon Player's Handbook
124215.description:
From the Back of the Book

Road to Armageddon: Player's Handbook provides the necessary framework (within the EABA core rules) for the creation of realistic characters for this (and other) post-holocaust settings - it also includes the material needed by a Player in the Armageddon setting, including:

Comprehensive listing of general equipment

Representative listing of common weaponry available

Representative listing of common vehicles available

124216.name: Galaxy Empire
124216.description:
Players start out with a single undeveloped world and attempt to build a huge empire in the universe. Along the way to their empire, players can form alliances with other players, research technologies to improve space ships, and perform various missions. Alliances are similar to guilds and serve many functions such offering members protection, enabling free trade among members, and consolidating forces for attacks. Although the game is text-based, Galactic Empires still looks good and has more action than most other games in the genre.

Source: The Developer Website.

124218.name: Fracuum
124218.description:
User Summary

A block goes in search of it's way through a maze. Gather a power up to allow you to shoot and try to reach the end. Each room you go into either makes you and the world smaller or larger. This allows you to travel further into the maze, or travel back out to see things you missed, or see the whole map. Very basic, pixelated graphics give it the feel of an Atari 2600 game.

124219.name: Turbo Kids
124219.description:
User Summary

A group of kids race in a number of matches. In each match you place a certain ranking to qualify to go onto the next match.
In this game you constantly run forward and can only choose to shoot or fire a weapon. You also will collect money to enhance your ability to throw snowballs, make them faster, give you shields, or get more bonus from speed boosting objects or more bounce from jump boosting objects.

124220.description:
A promotional expansion for Octopus' Garden.

Beauty Score 1. Add 1 Coconut Octopus into the tile pool for each player. The Octopus is Planted as a normal tile, with the non-hiding side facing up. At any point later in the game, after Planting and before Move Sea Stars, the player may reorganize any or all tiles which are touching the Octopus. The Octopus is then turned over to display the hiding side, and may not be used again during the game. If either a Seagrass or Anemone is moved this way, placed Seahorse(s) and Clownfish remain in the Garden even if their initial placement conditions no longer exist.
124220.name: Octopus' Garden: Coconut Octopus

124221.name: Solar Starfire
124221.description:
SOLAR STARFIRE is the sixth edition of the Starfire series. Starfire has two parts: tactical combat and a strategic campaign system.

The tactical combat is a fast paced, fleet-level starship combat system with both a tactical level and an operational level. The tactical level is where starships engage in ship-to-ship combat around planets and warp points. The operational level is where you maneuver your fleet of starships across a star system to find where your enemy is hiding. Starship designs are simple, easy to create, and the combat system is quick enough to let players destroy dozens of starships in an evening.

The campaign system allows a player to start an empire and control all aspects of expansion: research, construction, colonization, exploration, etc. in an attempt to build an empire. Designed with procedurally generated system generation and a non-player race generation, each campaign is literally unique. The campaign system has been made to be easily modified for custom games and the rules have a hundred additional pages of source materials to help create those custom games.

Originally started as an upgrade of the Ultra Starfire rules, Solar Starfire is based on Ultra Starfire and has become a living work with new goals and purpose. The rules are being built by a new team of developers that have plans to continuously adapt and upgrade the game with new material, new release methods, and most of all - the new storyline. Solar Starfire was built specifically for the history of the Terran Solar Union and will continue to be expanded as the story line opens up new possibilities.

Still using the unique tactical combat system designed in 1976, Solar Starfire is the same core gaming system as Starfire has always been. The new team is building free starter materials for new players to learn and demo the Starfire system, while the website maintains a community forum and a FREE downloads section with player-created materials and previously-available gaming materials for most editions of Starfire.

124222.name: Ars Mag (Issue 23 - Jul 2001)
124222.description:
Pour info
Édito
Sommaire
Les ampoules de Saint Janvier
Rencontre avec John Kasab
Quand il fermera, nul n'ouvrira
Les lapidaires
Concours de scénarios
Les mages lapidaires
Le crépuscule des mages : Episode 2
Bulletin d'abonnement
Histoire de Guorna la Fétide, Tremere et Tytalus
À l'horizon
Portrait de famille

124223.name: Buried Treasure
124223.description:
Somewhere on the island is buried a chest full of gold doubloons. The task of the players is to try and locate the exact position of this hidden treasure. It can be achieved by the simple means of elimination.

The map is divided into forty-nine squares which are numbered horizontally and lettered vertically (fig. 1). There are also fourteen 'location cards' each containing a reproduction of the island map and with either one row or one column shaded (fig. 2). At the beginning of the game, these cards are divided into two packs, one containing the numbered columns and the other the lettered rows. Each pack is shuffled and placed face down and the top card drawn from each. These cards remain unseen and give the exact location of the treasure. For example; should the card with column 3 shaded be drawn together with the card having row F shaded, then the position of the treasure is at square 3F. The twelve remaining cards are shuffled together and dealt equally amongst the players of whom there may be two, three or four.

Each player also receives eight digging tokens. Having looked at the cards in his hand, the first player will place one of his tokens on a square on the map board, say B6. If the player on his left has a card indicating either row B or column 6 or indeed both, then he simply says 'No' and the first player's turn ends with the knowledge that possibly the treasure is not buried anywhere in column 6 and/or row B.

Players continue to place tokens in turn until one of the players suggests the location of the treasure chest. That player then looks at the cards selected at the beginning of the game. If correct, that player wins, if not the cards are replaced face down and that player is out of the game.

A variant suggested by the inventor, which makes a longer but possibly a better game, is where each player only has one token and, after it has been placed on the board during the first round, it may only be moved to an orthogonally, adjacent square on each succeeding turn.

124224.description:
Game description from the publisher:

"You can make a profit in several ways – either by producing goods yourself or investing in other players' activities. But which method is more efficient – should you depend mainly on your own wisdom or would you prefer the way of passive investing? Answer can be found from Making Profit: The Boardgame. 2-6 players. Money. Stock. Production. Everything depends on you!"

In Making Profit: The Boardgame every player is both factory manager and investor at the same time. As factory manager you have to decide: should you run the factory for profits or develop it instead... and what area to develop: resource or products? As investor you have to choose the factories to invest into; should you stick close to your own plant or are there more lucrative options made available by opponents? But there are so few actions available each turn...and at the end the winner is the one with most combined wealth.
124224.name: Making Profit: The Boardgame

124225.name: Das bunte Blumenspiel
124225.description:
A colour recognition and memory game for children.

Game components: 25 cardboard tiles, 4 wooden pawns, 1 colour die

The game is divided into two parts. In the first part, players create the path towards the bee hive by throwing the die and adding a tile with a flower in the matching colour. Once all the tiles have been added, the second part of the game starts. Players now try to get their wooden bee pawn back to the bee hive. The die now dictates which flower is to be visited next. The active player has to memorise the colour sequence up to that particular flower and has to name it with closed eyes. They get to move their pawn up to the last correctly remembered flower. The player whose bee reaches the hive first wins the game.

124226.name: 0x10c
124226.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




0x10c is an Elite-like space simulation game. You will be able to fight, trade, loot, mine, etc, in an universe close to extinction. It is being developed by Notch of Mojang. It will feature an ingame, fully programmable DCPU-16 computer with Video RAM, and lots and lots of Duct Tape.

Game Features:

•Lots of engineering.
•Fully working computer system.
•Space battles against the AI or other players.
•Abandoned ships full of loot.
•Duct tape!
•Seamlessly landing on planets.
•Advanced economy system.
•Random encounters.
•Mining, trading, and looting.
•Single and multi player connected via the multiverse.

Source: The Game Website.

It was announced on April 3, 2012, by Markus Persson the game's lead designer. The game was eventually indefinitely postponed, however, as Persson lost interest in the project and opted to concentrate on smaller projects. The game has now been completely cancelled but a team of fans are working on their own version of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "0x10c", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

124227.name: Das Erntespiel
124227.description:
A harvest-themed racing game for children.

Components: One board with a spinner, 16 harvest cards, 4 pawns, 2 dice

Aim of the game: Being the first player to collect one's harvest (4 different harvest cards) and get it to the barn.

How it is played: Each player takes a farmer pawn, puts it on the corresponding farm space and places the corresponding harvest cards (potato bag, corn, cabbage and wheat) on the corresponding field. Players then take turns moving the spinner, throwing the die/dice (except during a thunderstorm) and moving their pawn.
The spinner shows the weather: Sun helps the farmer with the harvest - use both dice and move the corresponding number of spaces. Wind also helps the farmer to move faster - throw one die, move, turn the spinner again. Rain slows the farmer down - use only one die. Thunderstorms mean its too dangerous - the player loses one turn.
Pawns are moved from the farm to the field, where one harvest card is taken up and then brought back to the farm. On the players next turn, he moves his farmer to a different field etc.
The game ends when one player's farmer has taken all his harvest cards to his farm.

124228.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Engelsk – My Name is Pixeline
124228.description:
Om spillet
Pixelines ven krokodillen Ingolf har sin egen minigolfbane på Solø, hvor han spiller golf sammen med næsehornet Bobby. En dag får Ingolf besøg af sin familie fra England, og så skal der bygges nye golfhuller, mens Ingolf sammen med dig og Pixeline lærer at tale engelsk.

Spillet indeholder:

Golfboldespillet (tallenes navne på engelsk)
Farvespil (farvernes navne på engelsk)
Ingolfs lagerhylde (navne på ting på engelsk)
Danske og engelske golfbolde (sammenligne sætninger ? på dansk og
engelsk)
Pixelines kiosk (anvende tal/antal, farver og navne ? i ét samlet spil)

Et engelsk-spil i særklasse fordi:

- Det lærer dit barn engelske ord, sætninger og tal på en sjov måde
- Pixeline er den perfekte lærer ? hun opmuntrer altid børnene til at prøve igen og guider dem sikkert igennem opgaverne
- Der er mulighed for at spille på 3 sværhedsgrader, hvilket gør, at alle børn uanset niveau kan opnå resultater med det samme
- Der kan holdes øje med børnenes fremskridt og resultater via forældre feedback systemet
- Indstilling af spilletid (forældrekontrol)

Source: The Publisher Website.

124229.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Engelsk 2 – Pixeline goes to London
124229.description:
Lær mere engelsk sammen med Pixeline!

Pixeline besøger inspector Scotty på Scotland Yard. De mystiske mestertyve Mister Blue Potato, Mister Yellow Potato og Mister Red Potato går rundt i London og tyvstjæler fra nogle af Londons mest berømte og kendte steder som f.eks. Tower Bridge, British Museum og Big Ben. Du kommer med Pixeline rundt i London og skal hjælpe Politimanden Bobby med at lede efter spor.

Et engelsk-spil i særklasse fordi:

- Det lærer dit barn bogstaverne på engelsk samt engelske ord og sætninger
- Pixeline er den perfekte lærer, hun opmuntrer altid børn til at prøve igen og guider dem sikkert igennem opgaverne
- Der er mulighed for at spille på 3 sværhedsgrader, hvilket gør, at alle børn uanset niveau kan opnå resultater med det samme
- Børnenes fremskridt og resultater kan følges via forældre feedback systemet
- Der er mulighed for indstilling af spilletid (forældrekontrol)

Spillet henvender sig til børn i de yngste skoleklasser, og med 3 forskellige sværhedsgrader er der masser af udfordringer for børn på alle niveauer og forskellige klassetrin.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124230.name: 7.62 High Calibre
124230.description:
7.62 is a tactical action game, sequel to Brigade E5, similar to such classic titles as Jagged Alliance™, X-Com™, and Silent Storm™. A professional mercenary seeks for a Russian “businessman”, who stole a lot of money from his “colleagues”, then hid in a small country of Latin America to avoid inevitable punishment there. Soon the assignment turns into an intense and dangerous adventure, for there are many things that must be kept in mind – intricate political situation, confrontation between governmental military and rebels, not to mention a necessity to choose friends and foes wisely.

Sequel to Brigade E5: New Jagged Union, the best strategy game according to the GameLand Award 2005, “Best Computer Games”, “GameLand” and “Game World Navigator” magazines.
SPM (Smart Pause Mode) battle system combines RTS dynamics with diverse opportunities of turn-based gameplay.
Over 150 accurately modeled firearms with possibility for upgrade.
Varied ammunition as well as the extensive list of equipment.
Non-linear storyline gives you an opportunity to make you own choice – to reach one of multiple endings
Over 30 mercenaries.
Upgraded graphics engine.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124231.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Matematik – Pixeline regner den ud
124231.description:
Pixeline besøger Soløs revisor, Wolle, som har for vane at tælle alting.
Desværre er Wolles kaffemaskine gået i stykker. Uden kaffe kan Wolle slet ikke holde styr på tingene, og så må du sammen med Pixeline til at ?regne den ud?.

Spillet indeholder:

Menu (antal ? tælle ? værdi)
Sorteringsspillet (antal, plus og minus ? lige ? ulige)
Magi med Lillebror (tælle ? antal)
Skolegården (plus og minus)
Dunkelskoven (rækkefølge ? plus og minus)
Busturen (action regnespil)

Et matematik-spil i særklasse fordi:

- Det lærer dit barn om talværdier, at tælle, at lægge til og trække fra, at regne og sortere.
- Pixeline er den perfekte lærer ? hun opmuntrer altid børnene til at prøve igen og guider dem sikkert igennem opgaverne
- Der er mulighed for at spille på 3 sværhedsgrader, hvilket gør, at alle børn uanset niveau kan opnå resultater med det samme
- Der kan holdes øje med børnenes fremskridt og resultater via forældre feedback systemet
- Indstilling af spilletid (forældrekontrol)

Source: The Publisher Website.

124232.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Lær om geografi – Danmark på spil
124232.description:
Mange børn vil gerne lære hvor byerne i Danmark befinder sig.
Pixeline LÆR OM GEOGRAFI tager børnene med på en hyggelig og lærerig rejse rundt i Danmark.
Pixelines Lillebror er i drillehumør og er gået i gang med at opkalde alle Danmarks byer efter sig selv.
For at finde ud af hvor Lillebror gemmer sig, skal børnene med Pixeline rundt og besøge alle Danmarks kendte steder.
Undervejs får børnene spændende viden om Danmarks geografi.

Børnene får i LÆR OM GEOGRAFI viden om:

Placering af alle de større danske byer
Kompassets retninger Nord, Syd, Øst og Vest
Danske kultur-seværdigheder
Dialekter i Danmark
Danmarks farvande og øer

Source: The Publisher Website.

124233.name: Adrenaline
124233.description:
Adrenalin is a game that successfully blends the genres of thrilling adrenalin-pumping racing and an economic management sim. The aim of a player is to not only become the fastest driver around, but to be a talented manager as well. In the beginning of the game the player has to pick out one of the twelve beautiful young ladies. One of them even exists in reality — she is the winner of Miss Russia contest in 2003. Once you choose a character the task is to make your protege as successful and famous as possible. The world of Adrenalin is a world of a TV reality show where girls from different countries (USA, Russia, Ukraine, Sweden and even the Congo) compete to become the fastest driver and to make a bid for the sympathy of the audience. The more popular the girl becomes, the higher her rating grows, the more advertising and promotion offers she receives. The aim is to make the character a superstar not just on the track, but on TV, radio and covers of magazines.
First of all Adrenalin is a show and the audience loves to be entertained. The winner is not always the one to cross the finish line first, but the one who manages to amuse the public, the one who does it spectacularly, the one that makes the audience scream and applaud.

Key Features

12 characters — each one with her own skills and motivations;
8 concept cars designed by professional auto-designers;
Over 15 unique tracks built exclusively for the Adrenalin show;
Various car upgrades and tuning modifications;
Original gameplay which combines a racing game and a management sim;
