Different race types, including Knockout Race, Death Match, Circuit Race, Drift and others;
Spectacular special effects!
Joystick and force-feedback steering wheels support;
Original soundtrack featuring the most popular Russian rock acts.

Source: The Developer Website.

124234.name: A.I.M.
124234.description:
A.I.M. is the game about mechanical life of the future, struggle and confrontation, courage and slyness, reality which is a dead ringer for our own. This is the game for those who love freedom and is ready to make a decision.

FEATURES
Freedom of choice.
More than 30 different weapons, numerous bombs, mines and missiles.
30+ various glider types, including biomechanical.
Multiple optional glider upgrades.
A unique robotic social system.
Trade, spoils of war available for sale.
Realistic nature, real-time weather changes.
Huge sci-fi game zones.

BRIEF OVERVIEW
A.I.M. is a 3D action/RPG set in sci-fi world of extremely distant future. Game action unfolds on Range-4 - an abandoned planet, former a military test zone. Player shifts over the world in a glider - a multipurpose combat vehicle with antigravity engines. However, traveling is not the goal of the game, though exploration of a novel area exposes new opportunities. Player engages in combat, trade, fulfills different quests, communicates with the self-like creatures, and takes part in organizations' relations. He can upgrade his glider, buy more powerful weapons and gain access to hidden information and unique gliders. Life on the Range is full of danger and breathtaking adventures.

Source: The Developer Website.

124235.name: A.I.M. 2
124235.description:
A.I.M. 2: Clan Wars continues storyline of its predecessor. The opportunity to establish your own organization and to develop it is one of the main features of the game. Dynamic plot makes sequel thrilling and designing.

FEATURES
Artificial intelligence of mech and intelligence of the gamer are matches.
The opportunity to establish your own organization and to control it.
The opportunity to capture bases and other buildings as well as to take control of the whole sector.
Improved social system.
Expanded game world. 3 new sectors are on the planet surface and 1 new sector is in the underground. More new underground mini-locations in which some key events take place.
Improved system of upgrades which allows to upgrade practically all the elements of the glider.
Improved trade system. Debris and raw materials are available for sale.
New generating thrilling quests.
New types of rating: trade, battle, courier. Ratings and improved social system allow to reach a goal not only with the help of the weapon.
BRIEF OVERVIEW
A.I.M. 2: Clan Wars is a sequel in which action takes place some time later from the final mission of the game A.I.M. Super's control had dissapered so that new opportunities became available for mechs. New sectors were opened. After the Reformation (the process which has much to do with the Beholder) mechs changed greatly. Many of the old clans dissapered. Their goals sank into oblivion.
New organizations with the fifth gemeration mechs in chief are mighty formations of mechs with definite strategy and great aim. Alternative interests caused war which aim was at annihilation of the enemy. The opportunity to take control of the resources allowed strong organizations to destroy the weak ones with the help of economic strategy.
Equilibrium has been established temporarily. Nobody could turn to account this situation. That's why the Reckoners decided to set out in search of the first fifth generation mech. All the mechs knew that the first fifth generation mech is unsurpassed warrior who can resist strong clans on its own. But nobody knew what has happen to him and where he was at the moment. The Reckoners found out that he can be returned to the Range. The chosen mech managed to find him and bring him back.

Source: The Developer Website.

124236.name: A.I.M. Racing
124236.description:
«A.I.M. Racing» is your game if you like to drive at reckless speed razing to the ground your enemies. Just choose your glider and take your chance in a tough struggle for victory!

FEATURES
Over 50 races in the championship
Over 30 various gliders
Advanced combat tactics
Unique gliders dynamics
Traps and power-ups
A plenty of guns, mines and rockets
The detailed statistics, allowing to estimate your skills
LAN game
On-line table of records

BRIEF OVERVIEW
Description A.I.M. Racing is a hovercraft racing simulator based on the world of A.I.M. 2: Clan Wars game.
Action time: after the events occurring in A.I.M. 2: Clan Wars.
Scene of action: the special tracks constructed by the Network for the races participants on the distant planet Range-4.
For those who could not live without feeling the speed, a roar of engines and the plasma charges tearing the enemy's glider covering, the Network had created race tracks. Familiar, but the changed world with all its beauty is again opened for you. However there is no time to choose the accurate strategy, find the best place for selling goods and capture the enemy clan's base. There is only time to rush forward, avoid the opponent's fire and push away everything on the way. Full throttle! The Network counts every second, and no matter how fast you are, you have to be the first across the finish line to win.
There is no point in saving for new glider and thinking of buying powerful guns. The Network will let you choose any racing vehicle and set of weapons you want, just win!

Source: The Developer Website.

124237.name: Borderzone
124237.description:
“BorderZone” is a classic RPG with action elements. The role playing part here is implemented in a traditional way: characters that join the team, the heroes that have certain adjustable parameters and a permanent interaction with the game world – dialogues, completion of objectives, trade, exchange, receipt and distribution of the experience, movement along the storyline. The storyline of “BorderZone” unfolds in the Khamirr region which belongs to the game world that people call Therra. Time – nine thousand years A.D.. Nobody knows whether Therra is the future or the past of the Earth.

The adventures of the main character start on May 3285 (according to the local calendar) in Tharia – a province of Khamirr which lies northwards. His name is Olaf and he lives in the fort “Severny” which is located at the outside part of the northern extremity of Khamirr and is used as a base frontier point. While generating the character, you can select Olaf's class (thief, wizards or soldier), his skills, weapons and spells. The player will have an opportunity to control 6 characters at the same time; some of them are mercenaries (there are up to 10 mercenaries in the game) and join the team for a limited amount of time.

The storyline of “BorderZone” is non-linear and tells about the events that happen many years after a global disaster called the Breakup – a disaster that has taken away the lives of all 5 billions of people at once. Olaf is going to to explore new lands, get acquainted with many characters, complete great number of objectives, learn magic and art of war and, finally, enter a fierce battle with those whom the residents of Therra consider to be their Gods. The outcome of the resistance will become the fate of Therra – no less than this. Who will eventually rule the planet and live in this huge, mysterious, wonderful and diverse world which is not very friendly towards people? This depends on You...

Source: The Developer Website.

124238.name: Das WM Quiz 2002
124238.description:
Simple trivia game with questions on the Soccer World Cup 2002.

Components: board, 55 cards with 6 questions per card, 1 die, 6 pawns

How it is played: The die decides which question (number 1-6) on the current card the active player has to answer. 4 possible answers are provided. If the active player chooses the correct answer, he/she moves his/her pawn one space forward. If the answer is wrong, the pawn is moved one space back. 3 times per game each player may use a joker, which means that the player who reads the question reduces the answer options to two. The player who is first to reach the ninth and final space on the board wins the game.

124239.name: Classic Car Racing
124239.description:
User Summary

A game that lets the player drive cars in a period of history when they did not all look the same and when the roads were excellent but still not over-crowded. In an all sunny setting, where the beach is near, anywhere, you get to drive 14 different cabiolets from the 40's, 50's and 60's through approximately 60 miles of roads, split into 16 routes and challenges.

124240.name: Mind Your Marbles
124240.description:
Each player uses a brain-shaped board that shows twelve categories. Next to each category is a hole in which to place a marble. The three-pronged spinner displays the same twelve categories, as does each card in a deck of trivia cards. Players take turns spinning the spinner and answering the three questions on a card that correspond to the categories that the spinner points to.

The twist is that a player cannot answer any of the questions until all three have been read; meanwhile, the other players spell out a sentence --- one letter per player --- that appears on a card that is turned over after all the questions have been read. Thus, the guesser is trying to remember the answers to three questions, while the other players distract him.

A player places a marble on his brain next to each category for which he correctly answers a question. The first player to fill all twelve holes in his brain wins.

124241.name: Cuban Missile Crisis: Ice Crusade
124241.description:
1967. The Cuban Missile Crisis that led to World War III continues. Use of nuclear weapons resulted in global cooling which changed history and aggravated the struggle for survival. Inspired by the takeover of Europe and Africa the Soviet government decides to start an uprecedented military operation called Ice Crusade. Soviet expeditionary forces march over the Arctic and attack unguarded Amerian cities and towns. Deserted areas of Mexico and icy American megapolises become the new battle-grounds.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124242.name: Das Deutschland Quiz
124242.description:
Trivia game "60 years German Federal Republic", covering the years 1949-2009.

Components: 110 cards, 36 betting chips, 4 emergency chips, 6 pawns, one number die, 1 board.

Aim of the game: Being the first to reach the final space on the board.

How it is played: Each player gets a pawn and 6 betting chips. Each round, the active player throws the die, draws a question card and reads the question and possible answers corresponding to the roll of the die. The other players choose one of their betting chips (with values 1-3 on the back) and place it on the answer fields (A, B or C). After the active player has read the correct answer, a player who has put his/her chip on the wrong answer loses that chip. Players who bet on the correct answer move their pawn the number of spaces corresponding the value on the chip they bet. Their chips are returned for further use. Then it is the next players turn to read a question.
If nobody chose the correct answer, the active player gets to move his/her pawn according to the number of players in the game. If a player has lost all their betting chips, he/she gets an emergency chip (value 1). Players can earn back chips if they land on a city space (or they may chose to move 1-3 spaces instead: 1 space if he/she is in the lead, 3 if he/she is currently in last position, 2 spaces in all other cases).
The game ends when a player reaches the final space.

124243.name: Creature Conflict: The Clan Wars
124243.description:
Creature Conflict: The Clan Wars is a turn-based combat strategy game, heavy on the humor! The game takes place in a galaxy populated by four different animal clans, each faction battling for control over all the planets.

Creature Conflict: The Clan Wars boasts an extensive single player campaign, where gamers get to choose which clan they are going to control and start the process of total domination - engaging in battles with the other clans and their leaders. Creature Conflict: The Clan Wars also supports a multiplayer mode: team up with friends and take on all rivals in a last animal standing competition!

LAN multiplayer (up to 4 players)
4 warring clans
4 animals per Clan
1 leader (Boss) per clan
Turn based + real time action
16 unique planets
A fabulous, complex story
Huge arsenal of weapons (30+)
Multiplayer modes including: Rescue, Capture the Totem, Life Tag, Survival, King of the Hill and many, many more
Terrain generator to ensure long-lasting fun
3D sound engine for an overwhelming experience
Real-life physical model
State-of-art graphical effects

Source: The Publisher Website.


Creature Conflict: The Clan Wars is the new turn based, action packed, squad combat game heavy influenced by the great cartoons we used to watch on a Saturday afternoon!
You will take control of your elite squad of highly trained mammals and guide them through a single player campaign mode to take control of the Universe, or get together with some friends (or enemies!) across a LAN or Internet connection - or simple share a computer and enjoy any one of a multitude of exciting multiplayer modes, laugh as your Guinea Pig nukes there Cow! State-of-the-art graphical effects.
3D sound engine for a totally overwhelming experience
Real-life physical models
Dynamic wind affecting projectile trajectories
Individual graphics, terrain formations, and weather condition on each planet
3 (+ 1 hidden) factions to choose from
3 (+ 1 hidden) different units per factions
Diverse multiplayer game modes via LAN or the Internet
XBox Live, PS2 online support
12 (+ 4 hidden) single player missions
Battle on 16 unique planets
A fabulous, complex story
Humongous and fierce end bosses
Awesome arsenal of weapons ranging from FPS favorites to imaginary megablasters
Tons of hidden features/weapons/characters to unlock
Lots of competitive multiplayer modes
Terrain generator to ensure long-lasting fun

Source: The Developer Website.

124244.name: Desert Law
124244.description:
Ruffian-like real-time strategy with parody plot, which moves in the near post-apocalyptic future. Based on «Mad Max» action film, the game was being developed from December 2003 to April 2005 (for 16 months), supported by recreated licensed technology «Blitzkrieg» of Nival Interactive. Significant modifications and RPG elements were added to the original RTS gameplay. First of all, it is the story line combining all 29 missions and 7 heroes with unique alterable characteristics. The story of their struggle for survival with the cruel auto-bands takes place at the ruins of American southern states and it is illustrated in detail in cross-mission comics. Another game particular feature is its ironical and absurd humor, all characters' speeches, dialogs and quests are imbued with. Such bluntly cynical approach to the pathos of classical movies about «go-it-alone heroes» of the future imparted specific singularity and fun to the game.

Game Features
29 events-saturated missions;
30 comics episodes, consequently revealing the intriguing plot to the player;
46 types of once peaceful vehicles, transformed into infernal weapons of war;
7 heroes with various RPG characteristics and set of skills from mission to mission;
The opportunity for heroes to use any military equipment available in the mission;
Realistic American post-nuclear landscapes.

Source: The Developer Website.

124245.name: Generikus
124245.description:
From Introduction:

What you now possess is a modification of the Risus: the Anything RPG created by S. John Ross. Risus does what it was intended to do swimmingly; however, I have found myself wanting something that allows for a little more generic-ness to the rules that comprise Risus.

I enjoy the freeform mayhem of character creation and combat that Risus brings to the table, but wanted to add my own contribution. I wanted something that could be used to provide the oomph to power fantasy super heroes but at the same time have the capability to be scaled back to run a gritty horror campaign. Thus, GENERIKUS was born.

Consider this my attempt to grab Risus by the collars, slap it around a bit, get it to stop slouching and stand up straight.

124246.name: Dawn of Magic
124246.description:
In a realm of magic, the immortal Modo has been stripped of his powers and sent to live on the Earth as a mortal in punishment for his crimes in the Afterlife. Now the furious Modo is on a quest to not only regain his lost powers, but to gain enough strength to destroy the Earth once and for all.

As the story's hero, players must decide either to thwart Modo's plans for destruction and ultimately defeat this evil being or to aid him in his diabolical quest.

Dawn of Magic is a third-person RPG where the weapon of choice is magic. The game is set in a richly detailed medieval fantasy world, allowing the player a wide variety of choices both in individual quests and character development.

Dawn of Magic is different from most other popular RPG titles in that the player characters are all of one type: Mage. There are over a dozen different fields of magic, allowing players many choices for specialization.

The magical varieties are especially useful in multiplayer games, allowing each member of a party to have different specialization. The most unique aspect of the magic system is the ability to combine spells. The multiplayer feature of Dawn of Magic is the most innovative system seen in any modern RPG. In addition to converting the singleplayer story line to allow multiplayer gameplay, players may take their multiplayer characters and compete in 2-person duels or in large arenas against many others in true melee combat.

Key Features:
Original storyline with unusual characters and enemies
Vast spell system with over a dozen different spell schools
Spell combinations feature, creating almost limitless spell possibilities
Various modes of multiplayer online gameplay, including both cooperative and competitive games
Highly detailed character models and environments
Character appearances change based on magic school chosen

Source: The Publisher Website.

124247.name: Savage Worlds of Darkness
124247.description:
Author summary:

A conversion of the World of Darkness as presented in Monte Cook's World of Darkness for use with Savage Worlds.

124248.description:
Tóncc is a strategic game for two or three players with Simultaneous Action Selection.
The board is randomly build up by the 18 Tóncc (disks). Each Tóncc has a unique color/symbol. Each player has a dice, a cylinder and pawn. They secretly decide where to move their pawn and if to acquire the corresponding Tóncc. Goal of the game is to get one or more "three in a line" (colors or simbols) in fewer moves as possible.
124248.name: Tóncc

124249.name: Star Wars Galactic Conquest
124249.description:
From the back of the box: "The Rebel Alliance and Galactic Empire are at war - whose side are YOU on? Who will reign supreme in this clash between the Rebels and the Empire? The Galactic Empire and Rebel alliance are locked in an epic battle to take control of the galaxy. In this game, featuring classic Star Wars characters, players must use their troops to advance the game board, occupy planets, fight battles and ultimately conquer their opponent."

Star Wars Galactic Conquest is a hex based strategy game where players use pawns and character pieces to conquer the key planets of the Star Wars universe. Victory is achieved when all planets have been captured and one player controls the majority (5 or more) of planets.

124250.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Førstehjælp – Det lille bjørnehospital
124250.description:
BARNET LÆRER OM:

- Basal førstehjælp
- Hvad er hjertemassage
- Hvad er livreddende førstehjælp
- At vurdere farlige situationer
- At ringe efter hjælp

Spillet har ny musik specielt lavet dertil.
Læringen foregår på børnenes præmisser.
Der er 3 sværhedsgrader.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124251.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Lær om kroppen – Rejsen til kroppens indre
124251.description:
I LÆR OM KROPPEN lærer børnene om kroppens funktioner sammen med Pixeline.
Fredo og hans onkel, professoren, er aliens fra det ydre rum, som gerne vil lære noget om mennesker. Derfor beamer de Pixeline op i deres rumskib, så de sammen kan tage på opdagelse i kroppens mysterier. Robotten indsamler alt den nyfundne viden i et leksikon, som børnene altid kan slå op i.

Børnene får i LÆR OM KROPPEN viden om:

- Kroppens opbygning
- Kredsløbet
- Fordøjelsen
- Hjernens funktioner
- Sanserne

- alt sammen med formålet at give børn en forståelse for kroppens forskellige funktioner!

Spillet er udviklet i samarbejde med folkskolelærere og henvender sig til børn i de yngste skoleklasser. Med 3 forskellige sværhedsgrader er der masser af udfordringer for børn på alle
niveauer og forskellige klassetrin.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124252.name: The Game of Parlor Tennis
124252.description:
This dice game required each player in turn to roll the dice in order to determine if your shot cleared the net and either produced a winner or the ability for your opponent to return the shot


The game came with a fame board, 2 wooden dice and 3 wooden pegs used to show present location of the ball.

124253.name: Death Track: Resurrection
124253.description:
Death Track: Resurrection is a successor of the legendary Deathtrack, one of the founders of the combat racing genre.

Death Track: Resurrection is a racing / action title that plunges players into in the not too distant future, into a world of chaos. Traditional sports are replaced by far more aggressive, violent and thrilling type of entertainment the public screams for more. The attention of the Earth population is drawn to the main event of the year – “The Survival Race”. This is a World Tournament that takes place in the largest cities across the globe. Powerful vehicles and spectacular road battles are performed by world-renown drivers. This tournament, its fame and of course money attracts more and more new pilots every day.

The main character of the game is a rookie driver who enters the tournament for the first time. Soon enough it becomes clear that the battle on the track is not always fair. To achieve top results requires a belief that the end justifies the means. On his way to the top he will have to win many races and battles, eliminate numerous enemies and become a witness to great treachery.

Key Features
10 cities of the future: Bangkok, Vatican City, London, Moscow, New York, Paris, Prague, San Diego, Istanbul and Tokyo
Modern graphics and stunning visuals
5 racing modes with over 100 km of tracks
10 powerful cars with different upgrades and skins
Deadly weapons, mines, guided robots and different kinds of bonuses
Breathtaking stunts
In-game videos move the thrilling detective story
Modern graphic technologies - Bump, Specular, Parallax, Dynamic shadow & lights, Refraction and Bloom buffers, Sub Surface Scatering, Multylayered Materials
Accurate physics
Exclusive soundtrack

Source: The Publisher Website.

124254.name: Stones
124254.description:
Each player begins with a set of eight d8s in the same color. Three gray d8s that belong to no player are rolled first and are not re-rolled for the remainder of the round. Then, the remaining dice are rolled, and each player must freeze at least one of his dice. The non-gray, non-frozen dice are re-rolled, and each player again must freeze at least one more die. The round ends either when all players' dice are frozen or when the dice have been rolled four times.

At the end of the round, a player scores no points unless he has rolled three dice that match the face values on the gray dice. If his dice have matched, then his score is the sum of the face values on his five other dice. Another round begins, and play continues until a player reaches 150 points.

124255.name: Death to Spies
124255.description:
Released in 2007, Death to Spies is a stealth action PC game set in World War II. The player's character is a captain called Semyon Strogov in the eponymous Soviet counterintelligence agency - SMERSH.
Smersh is short for "Death to Spies" in Russian, and was the name of a set of counterintelligence agencies formed in the Soviet Army during World War II around 1943. Their mission was to secure the rear of the active Red Army by arresting traitors, deserters, spies and criminal cells. During the war these agents became the main force combating the German intelligence service.
As captain of the 4th department of Smersh, it is the player's job to execute these operations in the heart of enemy territory. Players are required to complete various tasks, including stealing important documents, eliminating enemy officers, kidnapping high-ranking officials, and sabotaging enemy plans.

Features:
Third-person stealth action immerses the player into the atmosphere of World War II military intelligence operations.
Different types of missions based on real historical intelligence and counterintelligence operations.
Freedom to choose the way a mission is completed.
Extensive real-life indoor and outdoor locations.
A variety of different spy skills at the player's disposal such as sneak, change clothes, carry dead bodies, mine objects, throw knives, sniping, picking locks, setting traps and many others.
Authentic weapons and vehicles of World War II.

Source: The Developer Website.

124256.name: Death to Spies: Moment of Truth
124256.description:
Moment of Truth is a sequel to the Death to Spies game. Released in 2008, the game's main character is still Semyon Strogov, a captain in the 4th department of the Soviet counterintelligence service called SMERSH (a Russian acronym meaning "Death to Spies").
The hero possesses the skills to accomplish dangerous missions that include gathering information on the location of hostile military and civil units and assassinating enemy agents, including the Wehrmacht's high-ranking officers. His task is to capture spies and saboteurs and gather information about their actions.
“Counterintelligence is not mysterious beauties, restaurants, jazz and know-it-alls, shown in films and novels. Military counterintelligence is a humungous hard work ...” — V. Bogomolov, “The Moment of Truth (In August of 1944)”
Features:
Brand new missions located in Western and Eastern Europe, USA, in the UK and the territory of the former USSR.
New vehicles and weapons.
Enhanced animation and visuals.
New graphic effects: new landscape texturing with higher resolution and bump mapping effects, updated rendering with HDR and dithered shadows.
A variety of different spy skills at the player's disposal such as sneak, change clothes, carry dead bodies, mine objects, throw knives, sniping, picking locks, setting traps and many others.
Moment of Truth contains a lot of improvements based on the game community's requests.

Source: The Developer Website.

124257.name: Pixeline Skolehjælp: Lær om Vikingerne – Kongekampen
124257.description:
LÆR OM VIKINGERNE

Med dette læringsspil introduceres barnet i hvordan vikingerne levede, rejste og handlede omkring år 1000.

BARNET LÆRER OM:

- Vikingernes handel
- Rejser til søs
- Svend Tveskæg?s historie
- Høvdinge og Konger i samtiden
- Vikingernes verdenssyn
- De Nordiske Guder

Spillet har ny musik specielt lavet til spillet.
Læringen foregår på børnenes præmisser.
Der er 3 sværhedsgrader.

Source: The Publisher Website.

124258.name: Secret of the Pit (Pathfinder Version)
124258.description:
From the product description:

In anticipation for the upcoming Age of Lords Campaign Setting and Age of Lords Expedition Guide, Blackbyrne Publishing is releasing Secret of the Pit as a FREE primer for an adventure set in our world of Thallorand. Secret of the Pit not only provides a free adventure, with our trademark 1" battlemaps, it gives both the GM and the player a glimpse into the upcoming Age of Lords setting. For the GM, there is a Thallorand based primer for bringing new 1st level players together with the cliché standbys. For players, there is a two level preview for the new class Blade Conjuror, which will be detailed exclusively in the Expedition Guide.

AS A BONUS: If you download this before the June (exact date TBA) release, you will get a link for an ADDITIONAL 10% off the sale price of BOTH the Age of Lords Campaign Setting and the Age of Lords Expedition Guide the day of their release!

124259.name: Secret of the Pit (4E Version)
124259.description:
From the product description:

In anticipation for the upcoming Age of Lords Campaign Setting and Age of Lords Expedition Guide, Blackbyrne Publishing is releasing Secret of the Pit as a FREE primer for an adventure set in our world of Thallorand. Secret of the Pit not only provides a free adventure, with our trademark 1" battlemaps, it gives both the GM and the player a glimpse into the upcoming Age of Lords setting. For the GM, there is a Thallorand based primer for bringing new 1st level players together with the cliché standbys. For players, there is a two level preview for the new class Blade Conjuror, which will be detailed exclusively in the Expedition Guide.

124260.name: Pokémon mini
124260.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

The Pokemon Mini was a handheld gaming platform completely themed around the Pokemon franchise. The system retailed for $39.99 in the United States, ¥4,800 in Japan, and £29.99 in Europe.

The system is the smallest cartridge based handheld gaming system ever released. The system measures at 74mm x 58mm x 23mm, and weighs only 70 grams with a cartridge and battery plugged in. The system was available in three colors: green, blue, and purple. Additionally, the Pokemon Mini contained an internal clock, accelerometer, built-in rumble, and infrared sensor to facilitate multiplayer gaming.

Cartridges for the system were close to the size of a postage stamp and retailed for around $15 in the United States, ¥1,200 in Japan, and £15 in Europe.

Only ten games were ever released for the Pokemon Mini before it's production was ceased.

124261.name: RétroFutur: Jeu de Rôle
124261.description:
Source: Wikipedia under the [http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ CC-BY-SA License.

English (translated from French):

RétroFutur is a French roleplaying game published by Multisim in 2002. Between science-fiction, 50's Noir and the paranormal, the players are offered to play résistants in a strange and dangerous world.

The setting

The world of RétroFutur is set in the revisited 1950's, the "Twisted 50's", in which there is no more governments, only specialized bureaucratic agencies ruling over the life of the administered citizens in its every details.

These transformations are due to the contact with the Strangers a century ago, when they offered humanity a new technology in order for the formers to settle.

However, alongside this well-oiled system, several powerful counter-powers have developed: mafias, terrorists, misfits and résistants, the latter being what the players will portray, in the wake of Jean Moulin or Einstein, fighting against the lies distilled by the Agencies. These heroes will move in a violent urban universe that is both oppressing and alienating, but which is also marked by the apparition of paranormal phenomena.

The game

At creation, the players choose their faction (agencies, mafias, terrorists, the lost) and the organization (The Agency for Peace, The Cosa Nostra, The Atlantis Brigade, The Dreamers...) which they originate from, plus the reason that made them join the Resistance. Alongside this choice, the players also have the possibility to create a Non-A, a psychic grappling with the paranormal.

The originality [of the game system] comes from the characters' attributes that are not represented by figures but by verbs unto which are associated fields. So, to make an action successful, the player constructs a sentence by using his skills and fields. Then, the number of relevant words being used are matched with a difficulty threshold in order to have the score to reach with a D10.

Finally, the Ubik, the key element of the rule mechanism: it is a common pool into which the players can slip "dead substance" for situations during which their characters are weakened. The GM can then take some dead substance and forces an hallucination unto the PC. The Ubik can then measure the degradation of the universe and infer that the heroes are lost in reality.

French:

"Rétrofutur est un jeu de rôle français édité par Multisim en 2002. Entre la Science-fiction, le polar 50’s et le paranormal, il propose de jouer des résistants dans un monde étrange et dangereux.

L'Univers

Le monde de Rétrofutur se base sur des années 50 revisitées, les « twisted 50's » où il n’existe plus d’États, mais seulement des agences bureaucratiques spécialisées gouvernant la vie des administrés dans ses moindres aspects.

Ces transformations sont dues au contact, un siècle auparavant, de l’humanité avec les Etrangers, qui lui ont offert une nouvelle technologie pour pouvoir les accueillir.
Mais à côté de ce système huilé, des contre-pouvoirs puissants se sont développés : mafias, terroristes, marginaux et résistants. Résistants qu’incarnent les joueurs, et qui combattent à la suite de Jean Moulin ou de Einstein, les mensonges distillés par les agences. Ces héros évoluent dans cet univers urbain violent, oppressant, aliénant qui semblent également marqué par l'apparition de phénomènes paranormaux.

Le système

À la création, le joueur choisit la faction (Agences, Mafias, Terroristes, Egarés) et l'organisation (Agence de la Paix, Cosa Nostra, Brigade Atlantis, Rêveurs...) dont il est issu, et la raison qui l'a fait rejoindre la Résistance. Parallèlement à ce choix, le joueur a aussi la possibilité de faire de son personnage un non-A, un médium en prise avec le paranormal.

L’originalité vient du fait que les capacités du personnage sont représentées par des verbes et non des chiffres auxquels sont associés des domaines. Ainsi pour réussir une action, le joueur construit une phrase en essayant d'utiliser ses compétences et des domaines. On compare alors le nombre de mots pertinents utilisés à un niveau de difficulté, pour avoir le score à atteindre avec un D10.

Enfin l’Ubik, élément clé du système : c’est un récipient commun où les joueurs peuvent glisser des « substances morts » dans les situations où ils sont fragilisés. Le MJ a la possibilité de piocher de la substance mort et impose alors à un PJ une hallucination. L’Ubik mesure ainsi la dégradation de l’univers, et induit que les héros sont perdus dans la réalité."

124262.name: Gib 8
124262.description:
Children's card game featuring Benjamin Blümchen.

From a hand of cards, each player adds a card to the face-up stack pile. The card added must be either the same colour as the previous card (thus changing the number) or the same number (thus changing the colour. Being a game for youngsters, after they have made a legal play, they can then add any other card from their hand to the stack (so, in one turn, they should be able to use two cards).

The first player to use all their cards, wins.

124263.name: Kinder Mau-Mau
124263.description:
Children's card game.

Every player gets five cards. A random card starts the discard stack. Each player must try to add a card to the stack. It must either be the same colour or the same number. Next player does the same and so on. If a player cannot make a legal play, he draws a card from the deck and adds it to his hand. The first player to use all their cards, wins.

To spice the game up, any player can play an Action Card to the discard pile in their turn. This causes annoyances such as;
Next player misses a turn;
Next player draws a card from the deck;
You can choose the colour that the next player must play to;
All players jump to their feet and make the sound of the animal currently on top of the discard pile. The first to do so is alright but all the other players must draw a card.
And their are further action cards than these examples.

124264.name: Zombies at your Heels
124264.description:
In Zombies at your Heels, 2-4 players each take an identical stack of survivor cards and try to lead them to safety, away from a pursuing horde of ravenous zombies.

Survivor cards are played in a queue that stretches from the Zombie Horde card to the safety of the Bunker card, and each survivor has a special ability - most of which manipulate the order of cards in the queue.

Each survivor card also has as a speed value and a points value. The speed value determines where in the queue the survivor starts when played, and the points value is how many points that survivor is worth if led to safety by the end of the game.

All profits from Zombies at your Heels go to benefit Special Effect, a charity that develops technology and initiatives to help injured and disabled young people to enjoy video games they would not otherwise be able to.

http://www.zombiesatyourheels.com

124265.description:
UNITY is a board game for 2 to 3 players, in which each player strives to unite his pieces… at any cost. By sacrificing the right pieces at crucial moments, you can shatter your opponents' groups as they coalesce, or eliminate a pesky splinter group of your own pieces — anything to create unity.

In UNITY, each player’s pieces start dispersed on the board. Your goal is to create a single group of connected pieces of your colour of any size (even just one piece).

UNITY was initially designed for 2 players, with the neutral pieces being just unmovable discs, but was later adapted to accommodate a 3rd player.

The Basic and Deluxe editions have been replaced by the new Unified Edition, that contains:

• A board with 91 hexagonal spaces.
• A supply of rectangular walls.
• 15 ring-shaped pieces of each colour (purple, orange, and green).
• 15 asterisk-shaped pieces of each colour.
• One counter of each colour to show which player is which colour.
• A carrying case
124265.name: UNITY

124266.name: Transylvania: the card game
124266.description:
Will you follow the path of righteousness and claim Transylvania for the good of the order?

Will you forge your own path and claim Transylvania through trickery and deceit?

Will you let loose your terrible rage to become ruler of a devastated landscape strewn with destruction and chaos?

The choice is yours. Welcome to Transylvania.

Players take turns playing territory cards from their hand. Each territory adds a certain amount of influence to a players domain. Each territory also requires a certain number of different signets to be placed before it is complete and can be added to a players domain. With each turn a new conquest card is revealed which allows all players to place signets on their territories.

To make things interesting, players can also perform other actions on their turn (drawing cards, placing signets, attacking other players, etc ...)

The game is played in rounds, called ages, which favor a particular faction. Each faction only has 5 ages available and once all five faction ages are complete, that faction is eliminated.

The first player to add enough territories to their domain to gain 10 influence wins the game.

124267.name: Undiscovered Quests & Adventures (Issue 1 - Apr 2002)
124267.description:
Publisher Blurb

96 pages of information to bring you deeper into the world of Arkas. This e-zine provides you with a new kingdom outline (Trenord), 2 adventures, 2 short stories set in the world of Arkas, 7 optional rules for use with the Undiscovered game, and more!

124268.name: Undiscovered Quests & Adventures (Issue 2 - Sep 2002)
124268.description:
Publisher Blurb

104 pages of information to bring you deeper into the world of Arkas. This e-zine provides you with a new kingdom outline (Astman Jungles), 2 adventures, 2 short stories set in the world of Arkas, 18 new spells, and more!

124269.name: Undiscovered Quests & Adventures (Issue 3 - Spring 2003)
124269.description:
Publisher Blurb

104 pages of information to bring you deeper into the world of Arkas. This e-zine provides you with a new kingdom outline (Radiant Tracts), 2 adventures, 12 new spells, 10 new poisons, and more!

124270.name: Undiscovered Quests & Adventures (Issue 4 - Summer 2004)
124270.description:
Publisher Blurb

88 pages of information to bring you deeper into the world of Arkas. This e-zine provides you with a new kingdom outline (Dourgal Kingdom Mountains), a 2-part adventure, 16 new spells, 5 new weapons, and more!

124271.name: Blockers
124271.description:
Blockers is a two-player variant of Chinese Checkers, as players race to move all their pieces from the starting location across the board to their home spaces (that is, the spaces originally occupied by their opponent).

The game is played corner to corner on a 10x10 board, with 15 spaces of each neutral corner not in play, resulting in a 70 space playing area. Pieces advance by moving to an adjacent space or by jumping an adjacent piece. Multiple jumps are allowed, in any combination of a player's own pieces or their opponent's.

Each player has 10 Runners and 3 Blockers. Runners may only advance forward toward their goal, never backward toward their starting location, while Blockers may move in any direction. Blockers may also jump over a contiguous line of pieces in its own colour. Finally, no piece may jump over a Blocker, not even another Blocker.

Success is determined by stringing "jump ladders" along for multiple pieces, and by judicious placement of the Blocker pieces.

124272.name: Blind 31
124272.description:
In this card game players try to replace cards in their hand of three cards so that it gets close to the target of 31 points. The twist is that they can't look at their initial three cards unless they are discarded in favour of other, hopefully better, cards.

Pagat.com says:

This game by Gary Woitzik combines the objective of 31 (Scat, Blitz) with a play mechanism similar to "Golf" (the card game). It uses a special 65-card pack which consists of the 52 cards of a standard Anglo-American deck plus 13 cards with special functions reminiscent of those found in UNO and other games: 2 Wild, 2 Reverse, 2 Skip, 5 Take All, 1 Scramble and 1 Swap.

124273.name: High Guard (First Edition)
124273.description:
From the back of the book:

At last, extensive rules for the personnel and starships of the interstellar navies of the universe. Detailed character generation for naval characters, including the academy, and medical school, and 5 new skills. Rules for starship design, construction, and combat, with tonnages ranging to one million tons!

High Guard, created for the interstellar naval adventurer and referee.

Be sure to look for Book 4, Mercenary, with its coverage of the army, the marines, and of military adventures.

User Summary:

This book covers Imperial naval characters and ships of the Imperial navy in the Traveller setting.

124275.name: Dream Entity: Shadow
124275.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A single-page Data-Packet containing the stats for the Dream Entity Shadow.

124276.name: Ballistik Wars
124276.description:
User Summary

Ballistik Wars is a Castle Defense Game. Two viking clans have a castle at each side of the valley. You need to destroy the other castle by producing all sorts of war machines that you send toward the castle. But watch out the enemy is coming for you.

124277.name: Terror from the Skies

rpgissuearticle.138400: On y a joué: L'Appel de Cthulhu: la terreur venue du ciel

124277.description:
From the publisher:

In Terror From The Skies investigators partake in a race to save the earth from malevolent creatures. Set in 1920s England, this adventure is rife with plot twists, mini-adventures linked to create a sizable campaign, and formidable foes. Investigators are lured into the campaign with a tale of local mystery, which slowly unfolds into a heart-pumping time-sensitive race for humanity!

This campaign intertwines historic events with mythos themes, creating an interesting and captivating experience for keepers and players alike. Terror From The Skies includes 10 chapters, an array of interesting NPCs, and a variety of maps and handouts.

124279.name: Virus
124279.description:
"Virus" is a fun board game where you battle to spread infection around the world. You act like a Virus and you lead a tactical fight. Each player is one Virus and your goal is to defeat other players and conquer the world.
The game is simple enough that it can be learned and played in a short time, and the battles are different each time you play a new game. This is a game for 2-6 players and co-operative play. Experienced players should be able to finish one game in 40-60 minutes.

Objective

There are 3 ways to win:
1. Termination: defeat all players.
2. Domination: conquer 30 cities.
3. Days of Infection: conquer the most number of cities after certain number of days (turns).

Components

1. A quad-folded map of the world
2. 6 dice (6 different colors)
3. 240 tokens (6 different colors, 40 tokens for each player)
4. The manual in full color with rules and lots of examples of play

Setup

This game can be played in following setups and modes:
1. 2-6 players (each player on his own).
2. 2 vs. 2 or 3 vs. 3 or 2 vs. 2 vs. 2 (co-operative play).
3. One or two experienced players could play against a greater number of rookie players.

Playing the game

The players take turns and all other actions in clockwise order.
Each day have 4 possible Actions:
1. Do nothing: player skips his day.
2. Infect: player on his day places only once a token on free city adjacent to his conquered city.
3. Bonus: player on his day places Bonus tokens on free cities adjacent to his conquered cities.
4. Attack: player attacks adjacent enemy tokens.

124280.name: Johnnys Farm
124280.description:
This game is a cooperation between tractor company John Deere, toy car company Siku and Schmidt Spiele.
2-4 very young children drive a toy tractor around a farm. For this, they roll a die which shows different symbols. For a fruit/vegetable symbol, the active player drives to the respective field, flips over one of the chips on that field and checks whether it matches his/her trailer color. If so, he/she can keep it. If not, s/he drives around the farm house. If s/he rolls a farm house symbol, s/he drives to the stables and takes care of a table of his/her choice. This action consists of acting, making animal sounds, etc. The first player to fill his/her trailer is the winner.

124281.name: Back to Basics Baseball
124281.description:
from the manufacturer's website

The Back-to-Basics Baseball Printed Game features a 100 card, die-cut, No-Shuffle Fast Action Deck and complete rules. Everything is printed in stunning, full-color.

This is a full-fledged baseball simulation. The game is fast playing and simple to learn, due to our No-Shuffle Fast Action Deck. Every element of the game is determined right on the Fast Action Cards.

Back-to-Basics Baseball features a unique batter-pitcher interface. Just like the real game, the action begins on the mound with the pitcher. Using a modified log-5 methodology the batter and pitcher ratings are combined to arrive at every result. While the ratings may look simplistic on the surface, they nail down each and every player to play on the diamond. 1961 Mickey Mantle will perform exactly as he did in real life. As will role players like 1983 John Wockenfuss.
Every facet of the game will come to life with amazing accuracy with Back-to-Basics Baseball. Players will hit, pitch, field and steal bases just as they did in real life.

124282.name: Outlive Outdead Playtest Edition
124282.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outlive Outdead is a cinematic roleplaying game where zombies exist and humans try to survive. Players take roles as humans until they are killed, at which point they play zombies. Instead of trying to recreate reality, the rules are designed to provide a tense cinematic experience, focusing on chases and trust.

124283.name: curse the darkness Playtest Packet
124283.description:
From Introduction:

curse the darkness is a roleplaying game about loss, remembrance, and fighting for what’s really important. Part of that is deciding — or discovering — what’s worth fighting for. curse the darkness is a post-apocalyptic game, and as such involves themes of reclamation and building a new world from the wreckage of the old.

This playtest document is designed to allow you and your players to play a game of curse the darkness with minimal preparation or reading. As such, this packet uses a simplified version of the game system (not that the actual system is all that complex anyway) and a minimized version of the setting. I’ve included some of the fiction snippets that have appeared as part of the lead-up to the game, just to provide some flavor.

124284.name: The Rifter (Issue 56 - Oct 2011)
124284.description:
The Rifter® #56
The Rifter® is your doorway to unlimited imagination and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new heroes, powers, weapons, magic and adventure for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider.

The Rifter® #56: The articles are expansive and fun.

•Rifts® in space. The orbital communities and weirdness, by O.J. Pinckert.
•Beyond the Supernatural: Tainted Martyr P.C.C. by Steven Dawes.
•Nightbane®: Dark Days Chronicles Four – short story by Jeremy M. Hutchins.
•For all game settings – Time Travel rules by Greg Spivey and Jason Smith.
•News and coming attractions.
•Fiction and more.
•Cover by Irvin Jackson.

124285.name: Zombie Samurai
124285.description:
"hey have come from within. They are missing from their graves. They are coming to get you! Are you prepared? Extremely evil, absolutely terrifying, and incredibly addictive arcade action fun! Zombie Samurai is your chance to see exactly how long you would survive when the Zombie Apocalypse becomes a reality.

Features

Frantic and addictive action gameplay!
The undead come in over 15 creepy forms; flying, walking, and creeping to eat your brains!
Adventure and Endless Night game modes! Try to hold out against the rising tide of terror.
Two game scenes (Day and Night).
Dojo upgrades to hold back the zombie plague.
Superb ragdoll graphics, hysterical zombie deaths, and catchy sound effects.
OpenFeint and Game Center support (leaderboards and achievements)."

Source: The Developer Website.

124286.name: Sky Trails
124286.description:
A card game about traveling from San Francisco to Shanghai, China. The cards of the game of Sky Trails are divided into two parts, Map Cards and Route cars. (24 of each). The map comprise 4 sets of 6 cards each, forming an end to end in proper order and from a route of plane travel from San Francisco in the west to Shanghai China in the east. The route cards show 12 important stops along the way with a picture of a point of interest, the flag of the country, a symbol or emblem or a person or two in native dress. There are two alike cards for each of these 12 stops These cards are numbered San Francisco 5, New York 10, Gander 15, Shannon 20 and so on, Each succeeding card stop traveling East increases in value by 5 until Shanghai (value 60) is reached.

How to play: Deal 9 cards to each player and place th reminder of the deck face down on the table Players draw a card from the deck either from the face down pile of the face up discard pile and then discard a card. The object is to lay down the 6 map cards showing a complete route from San Francisco to Shanghai. The first 3 cars of the lay down must be done together. The other 3 can be laid down one at a time if so desired, After getting the 6 map cards down the next objective is to get consecutive route card in hand an play the down 3 cards together saying I am getting off in Rome which means that you laid down Paris, Geneva and Rome cards and then discarded the other card in your hand scoring the total value of the cars, in this case 90 (25 for Paris,30 for Geneva and 35 for Rome, so the further east you travel the more points you will score. Completing a flight before an opponent has laid down his map cards gets you a 100 point bonus. When playing partnerships, you can play on your partners cards until one map of 6 consecutive cards is completed and then either partner can ask “Would you like to get off in Bombay or some other stop depending on cards held to which your partner must answer yes or no, in which case the one asking is bound by the response of his partner. However one partner may simply say we are getting of in Paris and then lay down the required cards. Scorekeeper then records the score at the end of each turn. First team to 500 or 100 wins the game

124287.name: Neon Wars
124287.description:
User Summary

Neon Wars is a fast action scrolling game. You take control of more than 10 different and powerful ships and you have to defeat hordes of enemies including big bosses.

124288.name: Undead Swarm
124288.description:
"Defend the city from furious zombie swarm! This is a 3D shooting game, where you are in control of an US army soldier defending a barricade. Kill as many zombies as possible during the night and survive until the sunlight hits and clears the level. Zombies mutate every day and develop their strength. Use the money rewarded each night to buy upgrades."

Source: The Developer Website.

124289.name: The Rifter (Issue 57 - Jan 2012)
124289.description:
Quantity in Basket: None


Share on twitter The Rifter® #57
Looking for new ideas and material for your campaign? Then you want The Rifter®. The greatest value of The Rifter® is that every issue offers new and different ideas, and gets your imagination running in directions you might not have considered. It’s an idea factory that will help you generate new ideas of your own, and it also presents valuable source material you can drop right into your games.

The Rifter® is your doorway to unlimited imagination and numerous Palladium role-playing worlds. It offers new monsters, villains, characters, O.C.C.s, powers, magic, weapons, adventure and ideas for your games. It presents new villains, monsters and dangers to battle, and new ideas to consider. Every issue has material for Rifts® and at least two or three other Palladium game lines.

The Rifter #57 is an extravaganza of monsters and mayhem to surprise your players and spice up your games.

•Rifts® – new weapons and vehicles of the Coalition States.
•Beyond the Supernatural™ – monsters and supernatural threats.
•Palladium Fantasy® – monsters and dangerous animals galore.
•For all game settings – Genie bottles and dimensional pockets.
•Rifts® – The Brodkil War Machinist.
•Rifts® – NGR Anthropological Field Operative.
•News, coming attractions, and more.
•Cover by Charles Walton II

124290.name: Open Sesame
124290.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Open Sesame, a.k.a. Ali, players re-enact the story of "Ali Baba & the Forty Thieves" – but as a push-your-luck memory game.

Each round, one player takes the role of Ali while the other players are all thieves. These thieves must repeat, in turn and without error, an ever-growing list of objects – these objects being the treasures that Ali Baba covets and wants to steal. The question for Ali is whether to stop or not before he covets too much and ends up stuck in the cave, with the treasures falling into the hands of the thieves.

Variant rules allow for only two to play Open Sesame.

124291.name: Embrace of the Zombie
124291.description:
From publisher burb:

Kincaid Larean, the president of ZeitGeist Motion Pictures, owes a lot of money to the kind of people you don’t want to owe a little money to, and he’s skipping town before they come to collect. It has been several years since the director, cameraman, and president of the company has bankrolled a hit. This has led him to take loans from the National Crime Syndicate at outrageous interest rates and deadly penalties for late payment. Kincaid is late on his payment. He’s very late. And he’s very scared of the penalty. At this point he fears for his life, with good reason, and he’s skipping town while the skipping is good. He’s called in every favor he could, and he was able to hire an unknown writer, his best prop man, an up and coming starlet who didn’t know better, and an aging icon that does know better but yearns for another shot at stardom.

Kincaid has every penny he could beg, borrow, and steal wrapped up in this last ditch effort to get right with the National Crime Syndicate by making a film: Embrace of the Zombie. He’s decided to promote his film as a silver screen spectacle by taking his crew to film on location in Haiti, saving all the money that would normally be spent on sets, extras, and props. So far the filming on the action-love story-pulp-thriller is coming along better than expected. That’s all about to change.

After a week of filming, Kincaid has taken his crew deep into the bowels of Sans Souci Palace, an exotic looking castle-like structure that has fallen into ruin. While scouting set locations for the climactic finale (the zombie attack scene), the prop master, Darby O’Hara, stumbled upon a section that had been hidden behind a large pile of rubble. Darby cleared the rubble and inside they found the perfect location: an old burial chamber with a large altar in the middle of the room.

User note: This adventure was a 2007 Gen Con Demo; Lair of the Golden Death is Part II.

124292.name: Amelia Earhart & The Treasure of the Piranha Men
124292.description:
From publisher burb:

AMELIA EARHART DISAPPEARS:
July 2nd, 1937 Amelia Earhart and her co-pilot Fred Noonan disappeared somewhere over or in the Pacific Ocean and reemerged as one of America’s greatest mysteries. During this adventure your players will learn the fate of America’s favorite female aviator, encounter beasts unlike anything that walks this Earth, foil a Nazi plot to take over the Pacific theater, and save the world from utter destruction brought upon by the return of a Great Lost God.
A group of Thule psychics determined that an area in the Pacific Ocean is generating a strange psychic feedback. This area is giving off strange vibrations that have been affecting the psychic’s dreams for months. Three months ago several psychics fell into a coma and have begun muttering a strange language that no one has been able to decipher. One of these psychics awoke from the dream state and began drawing an island over and over until his hospital room was covered in the same drawing from the floor to the ceiling.

124293.name: Demon Bear
124293.description:
From publisher burb:

A possessed child. A missing hero. Dead sheep and a demon bear. Just another afternoon in the center of the world.

Weeks ago a great cave bear was disturbed from it’s slumber by a large rat that thought to make a meal of it. Easily killing and eating the rat, the bear was largely uninjured by the attack and went back to sleep. However, the small bites from the rat became infected and a virus took over the slumbering beast...

124294.name: Monster Allergy YO! game
124294.description:
Monster Allergy is a cardgame, where players try to outbid each outher with the cards they have in their hands.

Players take turns choosing some cards of their hand. They play these cards in front of the player at the left of him and says a number and a color. This player can eather accept these cards and play new cards in front of they player that is next to him, with the only restriction that the number must be higher. Or he can say 'YO!'. When a player shouts YO!, you look at the cards, if the player lied and played a number less then the number he called the player loses some points. If a player has zero points he is eliminated from the game.

The surviving player wins the game.

124295.name: End of the Line
124295.description:
From publisher burb:

A group of passengers on a westbound train in the North African desert in the summer of 1935 suddenly find themselves in a life or death battle with Nazi agents and their mind-controlled brutes.

As chaos and confusion abound, can the heroes find a way out of a mysterious predator-filled jungle they suddenly find themselves in, or will they be forever trapped there, under its burning sun?

124296.name: Fiendish Plot of Dr. Mahrs
124296.description:
From publisher burb:

A mad (and not too mentally stable) scientist, Dr. Rom Mahrs, has discovered a device that creates a doorway between the Hollow Earth and the Surface World in southern California. Using the device, he’s moving creatures to his secret lab deep in the Louisiana bayou region.

Dr. Mahrs has always been looked down upon by his peers as something of a “Quack” or “Nutcase.” Still, he was able to get a job with the U.S. Army working on ways to defend against mustard gas attacks, but was fired for actions considered “publicly immoral.” He swore revenge for this insult.

124297.name: Rura-Tonga: Wreck of the Haruka Maru
124297.description:
From publisher burb:

A simple overflight of native fishermen in the South Pacific puts the characters on the track of a missing Japanese ship with a singularly deadly cargo. Can they discover the secrets of the Haruka Maru and put an end to its dangers?

The PCs begin on the Grumman G-21 seaplane Flying Fish, returning to Rura-Tonga from Port Moresby, New Guinea. It's a beautiful tropical paradise sort of day – brilliant blue skies, a bit of a westerly breeze, not a cloud to be seen as far as the eye can see.

124299.name: Lair of the Golden Death
124299.description:
From publisher burb:

In this scenario the action and adventure take up mere seconds after the last reel of Embrace of the Zombie. The characters now find themselves transported through the gateway created in the Haitian fortress, Citadelle Laferrière.

With a hazy-headed throbbing sensation, caused by the collapsing gateway, the PCs slowly awaken. They find themselves in the ruins of the once beautiful city of Shinar...

User note: This adventure was a Part II of a 2007 Gen Con Demo; Embrace of the Zombie is Part I.

124300.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Oath and Anvil, an expansion for Rune Age, adds two new playable races to the game: the dwarves of Dunwarr and the orcs of the Broken Plains. These proud factions each bring their own unique style of play to Rune Age. With their penchant for mining and love of wealth, the dwarves are able to quickly amass large sums of gold, then parlay it into devastating attacks against their foes. Meanwhile, the orcs display a single-minded lust for combat, proving that there's no orcish phrase for "half measure". Their all-or-nothing approach to battle rewards players who empty their hands to win.

Not to be outdone, the four existing factions have rallied formidable new units to their cause. Cunning Novice Wizards and massive Roc Warriors bolster the Daqan Lords' emphasis on hand control, while swift Leonx Riders and lumbering Forest Guardians capitalize on the Latari Elves' mastery of influence. The forces of evil are likewise emboldened; foul Vampires and fearsome Barrow Wyrms add their strength to the armies of Waiqar the Undying, while depraved Blood Sisters and corpulent Obscenes engage in ritual mutilation for the glory of the Uthuk!

New scenarios challenge your deck-building prowess and new Mercenary cards provide even more strategic options. Unite the tribes, fire the forges, and experience Rune Age like never before!
124300.name: Rune Age: Oath and Anvil

124301.name: Rails to the South Pole
124301.description:
Minigame using the Empire Builder system included in Train Gamers Gazette 2(1). The cards had to be photocopied onto cardstock, and the board had to be photocopied and laminated.

Players start with enough money to build short lengths of track, and by running their trains and delivering loads to various cities acquire more cash to expand their networks. Game had three Major Stations, no Medium Stations, fifteen Minor Stationsn; and six types of Loads (Fuel, Imports, Penguins, Research Equipment, Tourists and Dinosaurs).

Terrain costs are higher than in other games of this system: 2 for "Clear" and 3 for Mountain mileposts due to the snow and ice. Game is to $150 million.

Like all games in this system, game length depends on the number of players, roughly 20 minutes per player.

124303.name: Bulldrek: The Role Playing Game
124303.description:
User Description
Bulldrek is a competitive, combative role playing game with minimal and bendable rules.

Introduction
Initially, every Bulldrekker is a blank slate. They come with no inherent properties or abilities. A newly formed Bulldrekker is wide open to become anything he or she needs to fulfill the requirements of the story.

124304.name: Transatlantic Rails
124304.description:
An expansion combining both Empire Builder and Eurorails. Players start with a Freight train on each board as well as a Freighter to transport Commodities from one continent to the other.

Trains and Freighters must be in the same Port at the same time to transfer a Commodity, unless a Warehouse is built to store Commodities, ($10 in a Port).

Like the Trains, the Freighter can be upgraded to a Heavy Freighter to increase its load capacity from two Commodities to three.

Freighters take three turns to cross the ocean. Transatlantic deliveries pay double.

This variant is included in Train Gamers Gazette 2(1). Warehouses, Freighters and Port cards need to be photocopied onto cardstock and cut out before playing.

124305.name: Pixel Purge
124305.description:
User Summary

A 360 degree shootemup with a spacious area. Gain levels to power up and build up your ship with pixels in areas like critical damage, rapid fire, regeneration, piercing bullets, spread shot, a magnet to attract pixels, and increase the points gained.

124311.name: Ortho
124311.description:
Ortho is a game intended to sensitize players to correct writing. It aims to do this by making spelling entertaining and the more they play the more they learn.

Each player takes a token. Then each player takes a card that has 25 words that are arranged in 3 columns labeled Beginner, Intermediate and Expert. Each player takes turns reading a word for another player to spell. If the word is spelled correctly the player moves a space on the board. The winner is the player who reaches the finish line first.

124312.name: Wooly-Wooly
124312.description:
We want to introduce our new really funny and great game!
The object of the game is to run your lap whether it's a sprint or long distance, faster than your opponent.

You are a comic monster of your choosing which you can trick out with accessories.

We are thinking about a name for this game and have some versions we've come up with:

Wooly-Wooly
Nimbles
Shustriki




not much Luck yet.

We'll give promo-code for everyone who can suggest good name for this game.

Story:

The game's plot centers around a mythical city, ShustroGrad , which is inhabited by good-natured, funny little monsters called Shustriki.

Shustriki are normally invisible because they appear only in the dreams of young children. Their sole purpose is to deliver good dreams to obedient children.

Every year Shustrograd stages a spectacular race to decide the fastest of all the Shustriks.

It's your mission to help your Shustrik win this difficult competition.

Train your Shustrik and lead it to victory!
Game Features:


Animated Graphics
Really cute animations and SFXs
4 unique characters
20 levels
3 unique types of game-play - sprint, steeplechase and marathon.
Variable weather conditions
Ability to use doping (don't get caught!)


You can find some screens:

124313.name: Shifty
124313.description:
Shifty Homepage at the Designer's Site

Shifty is a square board connection game, where the goal is to create a chain of orthogonally and/or diagonally connected stones between two opposite edges of the board.

The unique feature of Shifty is that on your turn you must either place a stone orthogonally adjacent to at least one friendly stone or you must move any friendly stone, by a chess queen's move, to any empty intersection orthogonally adjacent to fewer friendly stones than the intersection it started on.

As a result you must often forego adding a stone to the board, and instead "shoot" a stone already on the board to a strategically key spot. This sharpshooting dynamic is the source of the game's strategic interest.

124316.name: Alchemist Atlier
124316.description:
User summary

A home-made Japanese board game. Players are alchemists, and take turns collecting various resources from different areas of the board; certain more dangerous but more rewarding, and others safe but rather cheap. These are then used to create various objects which gain points. Players can also hire assistants to help out and raise their stats so that materials from more dangerous areas can be collected.

Comes with mounted board, cards, wooden cubes, paper money and dice.

124317.name: Little Troubles Come In Big Packages
124317.description:
From publisher burb:

Ages ago an advanced civilization developed a technology that allowed them to reduce things, both inanimate objects and living creatures, down to less than 2% of their original size. Thought to be a perfect way to store materials for future use, it was soon learned that, after a short period of time, the process could not be reversed and whatever was “shrunk” remained that sized indefinitely.

While traveling through a heavily forested section of a valley, the characters happen upon a small building, the size of a child’s dollhouse, partially ruined by fire...

124318.name: Flattermax
124318.description:
Whoever is skillful enough to flick the bat off into his or her own compartment gets a star. The game ends when a player has 3 stars in his/her compartment and thus wins the game.

The rules contain also special rules for advanced players and for young children.

124319.name: The Maritime Massacre
124319.description:
From publisher burb:

An expedition to Shangi-La gets sidetracked while on the trans-oceanic journey. Much intrigue and undead. It ain't pretty folks.

124320.name: The Mystery of Prometheus Island
124320.description:
From publisher burb:

A group of explorers head out into the Atlantic, on course to a point on a map, directed by a cryptic note. There they discover a derelict ship, a mysterious island, the ruins of an ancient civilization and beasts found only in the writings of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. Can they make it back home when their ship disappears from the middle of a tranquil cove?

The driving force behind the adventure is a woman who was left a set of map coordinates off the Florida coast (29.XX N 76.YY W) by a dying uncle most of the family called a “loonie.” Still, to her, the wild stories of adventure in exotic locations her uncle told has sparked her curiosity as to what may lie hidden around the world. Now aboard a small chartered boat, the Carolina Dreamer, she speeds toward an adventure she’s sure her late uncle wants her to enjoy.

124321.name: Operation Sinterklaas
124321.description:
From publisher burb:

The players learn that the nefarious Thule Society have put in motion a plot to travel to the North Pole and abduct Santa Claus. The players must give chase to make sure that Christmas remains safe for another year.
This adventure is designed as a one shot mission using pre-generated characters found in the HEX books, though your players can make their own characters if they prefer. Not all of those characters would be appropriate for this adventure, but there are more than enough. This adventure can handle up to eight characters, for reasons that will become clear later in the adventure.

You could also use this adventure as the starting point of an ongoing campaign or as a transitional adventure in an existing campaign taking your characters inside the Hollow Earth for the first time. At the end of the adventure, you will be given the option of having your players returned safely to the surface or leaving them inside the Earth to explore its mysteries further.

124322.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Into the Fiery Depths! Delve into the next level with Caverns of Roxor, the first major expansion to Super Dungeon Explore. Expand game play for both Hero and Consul players, and build your battle strategy with new monsters, heroes, and treasures. This expansion includes:


31 fully assembled Soda Pop Miniatures
New Boss: Roxor, and his assistant, Rock Gut the Troll
3 New Heroes: Princess Ruby, Deeproot Scout, and Star Guild Scrapper
New minions with unique treasure cards: Rock Tops and Fireflow Denziens
124322.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Caverns of Roxor

124323.name: The Strategy Game
124323.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that The Strategy Game is a non-authorized version of Blokus Duo.




In this two-player game, players place geometric figures onto the board, but must place such that their new piece touches at least one of their previous pieces, but at corners only. The player who gets the most of his or her pieces placed by the end of the game is the winner.

Though named the same, this is not identical to The Strategy Game, a similar unauthorized replica but of Blokus i.e. for four players.

124324.name: Froggammon
124324.description:
Froggammon is based on the game backgammon and is designed for younger players.

The board consists of modular lily tiles. In the middle there is a large central tile connecting four paths of six lily leaves. Each of the paths is closed by a larger starting area where a player places six pieces of his colour.

The aim of the game is to hop through the water lilies and get all of your frogs to you opponents’ lily pads. On one leaf there can be multiple pawns of the same player. Another player can only put his pawn on a leaf when there is only one pawn of an opponent. In that case the pawn of the opponent has to start over from his starting tile.

The game is stored in a handy storage case with a handle.

124325.name: Wyścigi rydwanów
124325.description: Wyścigi rydwanów is a racing game based on roll-and-move mechanics on the topic of chariot racing in ancient Rome. The board depicts a stadium with a grid of squares. Players race around it using chariots with different strengths and speeds. Movements are determined by six-, eight- or ten-sided dice. Special tokens are used to modify movements or to harm other players. A chariot can be eliminated if too much damage is done to it.

124326.name: Rampage of the Frozen Terror!
124326.description:
From publisher burb:

A small friendly tribe living on a frozen valley have fallen under attack by a great beast. A beast who seems intent on driving them from their home. Can a noble party of adventurers stop the marauding beast and determine its true motives before the Yu-Kur tribe leaves their ancestral hunting grounds forever?

The Yu-Kur tribe have shared a valley with another tribe, the Uu’lans, for generations. It is a rich, green valley in the summer, and plentiful hunting grounds for Woolly Beasts in the winter times. But recently the Uu’lan discovered gold in the great river. Worthless for tools, they use it for ornament. When ocean pirates, who trade with them in the winter months, saw this they became eager to drive the Yu-Kur from the valley and claim the rich gold fields for themselves.

124327.name: Throne of the Lizard Emperor!
124327.description:
From publisher burb:

A group of explorers sets out to a remote mountaintop deep in the Andes, somewhere in eastern Peru. There, driven by their own motivations they encounter a German science outpost, a lost scientist and hordes of crazed monsters all amongst the ruins of an ancient Inca city.
What are the Germans up to and can the result of their horrible experimentations be stopped before mankind is made to suffer?

124329.name: Commander Knight and the Nazi Saucermen - Chapter One: Rule Amazonia!
124329.description:
From publisher burb:

The Golden Lady: Professor Mathias, a senior member of the Smithsonian staff, was recently presented with a gold statue found in the darkest jungles of the Amazon. This statue was intriguing in that it depicted an Amazon warrior, stereotypical in every way except for a: the fact that she wore a jaguar skin cloak, clearly depicted, and b: the statue turned up half a world away from Greece.

Professor Mathias lobbied the Smithsonian for funding and put together an expedition into the Rio Negro region of the Amazon, where the statue was found. That was 90 days ago and no one has heard from him. When the Smithsonian sent people to check on him they found the camp empty, apparently simply abandoned by the Professor and his troupe.

124330.name: Star Trek Deep Space Nine
124330.description:
Space station "Deep Space Nine" has been invaded by "Cardasians", and the mission is take them out. You should go to "OPS" where there are the main controls of the space station with enough attack counters to defeat "Cardasians". There you can drive it and all their systems. The winner become the Space station Commander.

Each player has a pawns and a set of "attack counters" of the same color that start at SA box at external ring. The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "OPS" at the center of the board.

Movement is controlled by dice. During movement you should get "attack counters" entering at "Cardasian Police" boxes. All players move around the three parts of the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to start box ("SA"). You can only move in the same direction until you enter in a "P" box (bridge boxes). From external ring, you should use "LR" box (runebounds shuttle boxes) to go to internal ring. Then, in order to go to central laberynth, you should enter at "P1" boxes with the exact number. Whether you fail, your pawn shuold come back by central gallery to "SA" start box, and you should start the attack again!

The winner is the first player to move his pawn to "OPS" box. He shall be shuttle Commander. The second one shall be the Captain and the third one the lieutenant. Both players shall meet a minimum attack counters (4 & 3 ones).

124331.name: Dani's Emporium in Brian's Wing
124331.description:
From publisher burb:

Welcome to the doors of Dani's Emporium found in that beautiful cradle of civilization, Brian's Wing. Within our shelves you’ll find all manner of Exotic, Unique and dare I say, Strange, oddities from across the far oceans and even your own back yard!

Located between Andre's Wax & Oil and Old World Clothier on Seaview Lane, Dani's was opened by her father, Ruppert, in 1881. Ruppert was one of the original porter/guards with the Brian Expedition and was credited with killing the famed “black-toothed terror” that ravaged the area in the early days of the settlement.

124332.name: The Field Notes of Dr. C. Arthur Turner, Sc.D, Ph.D.
124332.description:
From publisher burb:

Dr. Turner's Journals are consolidated forms of his field notes and companion descriptions, also found on this site. Each journal covers a particular period, compiling and updating previously published notes, as well as adding new material. The fields notes are presented in one section, while game-related material, like creatures stats, are in a second with crossreferences.

124333.name: Dark Eon Assassin
124333.description:
